title: Time_Synchronizer Error getting server time
body:
### Describe the bug

Hummingbot's time synchronizer returns errors on any system. Fresh install or old, using version 1.x to 2.0.1, the logs fill up quickly with time synchronizer errors. 

This appears to be due to my location in the USA, Hummingbot using Binance".com" for time, and Binance.com blocking the USA. 

Quote from traceback:
> "msg": "Service unavailable from a restricted location according to 'b. Eligibility' in https://www.binance.com/en/terms. Please contact customer service if you believe you received this message in error."

I found a way for USA local Users to patch their systems - change line 4 of hummingbot/connector/exchange/binance/binance_constants.py to `DEFAULT_DOMAIN = "us"`

It seems that some level of domain auto-detect may exist but is non-working.


### Steps to reproduce

1. Be in the United States
2. Follow the official Hummingbot Installation Guide
3. Launch Hummingbot
4. Time synchronizer errors will appear frequently in the output window and logs.

### Release version

2.0.1

### Type of installation

Source

### Attach required files


From logs.hummingbot.log:

title: Controllers stop working after connection issues (Docker only)
body:
### Describe the bug

When hummingbot is running in Docker (and only in Docker! I can't reproduce this bug using the source code), and loses connection to the exchange (I just disconnect WiFi to simulate this), it doesn't go to the `NOT_CONNECTED` state properly, and once the connection is re-established, it doesn't go to the `CONNECTED` state properly, causing **complete stoppage of strategy execution**.

This is 100% reproducible, but not easy to fix (I haven't found a way).

My investigation:
`hummingbot/strategy_v2/controllers/controller_base.py` has a method `async def control_task(self)`, which is still called from `RunnableBase -> control_loop()` even after reconnecting, but the `self.market_data_provider.ready` flag is `False`, so neither `self.update_processed_data()` nor `self.determine_executor_actions()` of the controller are called.

`market_data_provider.ready` is `False` because one of connectors is not ready in `hummingbot/data_feed/market_data_provider.py`:
```
    @property
    def ready(self) -> bool:
        # TODO: unify the ready property for connectors and feeds
        all_connectors_running = all(connector.ready for connector in self.connectors.values())
```
(I only use 1 connector at a time, `binance` or `binance_perpetual`, and the error is reproduced with either one)

Finally, the connector is not ready because `self._is_user_stream_initialized() is False` in `ExchangePyBase` (`hummingbot/connector/exchange_py_base.py`):
```
    @property
    def status_dict(self) -> Dict[str, bool]:
        return {
            "symbols_mapping_initialized": self.trading_pair_symbol_map_ready(),
            "order_books_initialized": self.order_book_tracker.ready,
            "account_balance": not self.is_trading_required or len(self._account_balances) > 0,
            "trading_rule_initialized": len(self._trading_rules) > 0 if self.is_trading_required else True,
            "user_stream_initialized": self._is_user_stream_initialized(),  # <----- this one is False!
        }

    @property
    def ready(self) -> bool:
        return all(self.status_dict.values())
```

Debugging `UserStreamTrackerDataSource` led me to **several concurrently running loops** here:
```
    async def listen_for_user_stream(self, output: asyncio.Queue):
        while True:
```
and I decided to report bug here.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Add debug log to the `hummingbot/strategy_v2/controllers/market_making_controller_base.py`:
```
    async def update_processed_data(self):
        reference_price = self.market_data_provider.get_price_by_type(self.config.connector_name,
                                                                      self.config.trading_pair, PriceType.MidPrice)
        self.processed_data = {"reference_price": Decimal(reference_price), "spread_multiplier": Decimal("1")}
        self.logger().info(f"Updated processed data: {self.processed_data}")  # <----- add this row!
```

2. Add the appropriate section to `conf/hummingbot_logs.yml` to see these logs:
```
    hummingbot.strategy_v2.runnable_base:
        level: INFO
        propagate: false
        handlers: [console, file_handler]
        mqtt: true
```

3. Save the `conf_controller_update_bug.yml` to the `conf/controllers/` and `conf_script_update_bug.yml` to the `conf/scripts/` directory (attached).

4. Update the `docker-compose.yml` to build a new image with our changes:
```
version: "3.9"
services:
  hummingbot:
    container_name: hummingbot
    image: hummingbot/hummingbot:update_bug_check
    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    volumes:
...
```

5. Run it as usual with:
```
docker compose up -d
docker attach hummingbot
```

Enter your password, add a connection to the `binance_perpetual` if you don't have it yet.

6. Run the script with `start --script v2_with_controllers.py --conf conf_script_update_bug.yml` command, wait for the first 2 orders to be sent and for the ‘Updated processed data’ logs to start appearing every second:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/484918cb-af46-4b80-944e-e8ceeec38ddc)

7. Disconnect your PC from the internet for 30-60 seconds.

8. Connect it back. Look at the logs (`logs/logs_conf_script_update_bug.log`).

**First observation**: after losing the connection, even when exceptions appear in the log, it continues to print `Updated processed data` (so it doesn't know it's disconnected):

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fc26dad5-56c0-494c-90ef-3695e51f2943)


**Second observation**: after connection is back, it lost existing orders, send 2 new ones.
(you can check my log for orders `x-3QreWesyBDEUT62277a30f4070d54d` and `x-3QreWesyBDEUT62277a30f4070d54d` - they weren't canceled).

**Finally**, it just stops. No more new messages in the log, no `Updated processed data` messages, no executions, just nothing.

### Release version

2.0.1

### Type of installation

Docker

### Attach required files

[update_bug.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17058879/update_bug.zip)

title: Websocket Connection Issue / Coinbase Advanced Trade/ Pure Market Making
body:
### Describe the bug

I'm encountering an issue while running the pmm strategy on Hummingbot with the Coinbase Advanced Trade API. The strategy places orders successfully, but Hummingbot fails to recognize that the orders have gone through, leading to further complications when the strategy is stopped. Here are the details:

Issue with Order Tracking and Recognition:
The strategy submits buy and sell limit orders that are successfully placed on the Coinbase Advanced Trade platform.
Despite successful order placement, Hummingbot logs errors indicating failure to submit these orders and fails to track their status accurately.
Errors logged include:
"Error submitting sell LIMIT_MAKER order to Coinbase_advanced_trade for 0.00014 BTC."
"Failed to submit SELL order to Coinbase_advanced_trade. Check API key and network connection."
This leads to the orders not being tracked in the Hummingbot client, and their status remains "Open" even after they are filled or canceled on the exchange.

WebSocket Connection and Order Book Issues:
The order book subscription is initiated correctly, but an error occurs when processing WebSocket messages.
Error messages include:
"Unexpected error occurred when listening to order book streams. Retrying in 5 seconds..."
A TypeError in the json method, "the JSON object must be str, bytes or bytearray, not WebSocketError."
As a result, the strategy does not receive updates on the order book or track client orders accurately.

Due to Hummingbot not recognizing the status of the orders, when the strategy is stopped, the open orders remain on the exchange.
This requires manual intervention to cancel the orders directly on Coinbase, creating inefficiencies and increasing the risk of unintended trades.




![Screenshot (123)](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f8df087e-2a97-4ff5-ba71-28aa54f0a223)
![Screenshot (124)](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8acb6c94-22c2-4c09-a77d-469e6b170514)

title: Allow disabling stop_loss and take_profit in PMM_simple

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

body:
### Feature Suggestion

In the PMM simple strategy, stop_loss and take_profit can only be configured within `0 < value <= 1.0`. This means the stop loss and take profit logic can't be entirely disabled, which is a pity. Also, why limit take profit at 100%?

It would be great if `None` was accepted in the config yml

### Impact

The PMM simple strategy currently is dangerous for low-liquidity pairs where prices can easily be manipulated and cause stop loss traps. This feature suggestion would allow users to disable the risk mitigation strategies entirely

### Additional context

_No response_

title: Bybit Perpetual - Upgrade API to V5
body:
### Description

Bounty to update bybit_perpetual connector API to V5

Bybit had a newsletter where is officially informed that they will suspend the use of our old version openAPI service. This decision was made in order to reduce unnecessary maintenance and cost, and also to ensure the stability bybit platform. 
Users can migrate to [V5 API](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs/v5/intro), which has the full ability.

> 
> Details regarding to offline plan:
> 
> 1. Offline market Rest API endpoints and public websocket stream on 16 OCT 2023
> 
> USDC Option V1 [Market Data Rest API Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/usdc/option/#t-marketdata) , [Public Topics](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/usdc/option/#public-topics)
> 
> USDC Perpetual V1 [Market Data Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/usdc/perpetual/#t-marketdata) , [Public Topics](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/usdc/perpetual/#t-publictopics)
> 
> Spot V1 [Market Data Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/spot/v1/#t-marketdata) , [Public Topics V1](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/spot/v1/#t-publictopics) , [Public Topics V2](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/spot/v1/#t-publictopics_v2)
> 
> Inverse Perpetual V2 [Market Data Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/futuresV2/inverse/#t-marketdata) , [Public Topics](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/futuresV2/inverse/#t-publictopics)
> 
> Inverse Futures V2 [Market Data Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/futuresV2/inverse_futures/#t-marketdata) , [Public Topics](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/futuresV2/inverse_futures/#t-publictopics)
> 
> USDT Perpetual V2 [Market Data Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/futuresV2/linear/#t-marketdata) , [Public Topics](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/futuresV2/linear/#t-publictopics)
> 
> 
> 2. Offline private Rest API endpoints and private websocket stream on 30 OCT 2023
> 
> USDC Option V1 [Account Data Rest API Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/usdc/option/#t-accountdata) , [Private Topics](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/usdc/option/#private-topics)
> 
> USDC Perpetual V1 [Account Data Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/usdc/perpetual/#t-accountdata) , [Private Topics](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/usdc/perpetual/#t-privatetopics)
> 
> Spot V1 [Account Data Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/spot/v1/#t-accountdata) , [Wallet Data Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/spot/v1/#t-wallet) , [Leveraged Token Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/spot/v1/#t-lt) , [Cross Margin Trading Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/spot/v1/#t-crossmargintrading) , [Private Topics](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/spot/v1/#t-privatetopics)
> 
> Asset V1 [Transfer Data Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/account_asset/v1/#t-transfer_api) , [Withdraw and Deposit Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/account_asset/v1/#t-withdraw_and_deposit)
> 
> Inverse Perpetual V2 [Account Data Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/spot/v1/#t-accountdata) , [Wallet Data Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/spot/v1/#t-wallet) , [Private Topics](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/futuresV2/inverse/#t-privatetopics)
> 
> Inverse Futures V2 [Account Data Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/futuresV2/inverse_futures/#t-accountdata) , [Wallet Data Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/futuresV2/inverse_futures/#t-wallet) , [Private Topics](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/futuresV2/inverse_futures/#t-privatetopics)
> 
> USDT Perpetual V2 [Account Data Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/futuresV2/linear/#t-accountdata) , [Wallet Data Endpoints](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/futuresV2/linear/#t-wallet) , [Private Topics](https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs-legacy/futuresV2/linear/#t-privatetopics)
> 
> 
> Thank you for your continued support and understanding.
> 
> Best regards,
> 
> The Bybit Team

title: XEMM - Maker order filled while cancellation in progress due to trade probability threshold
body:
### Describe the bug

When reviewing logs of long term bot, found a behavior where:

- The marker successfully create a limit order 
- The maker order trade probability is below minimum target therefore cancellation in progress
- While cancellation in progress, the maker order got filled 
- Therefore returns an error of `Failed to cancel order orderXXXX (order not found)`
- No taker market order created (which would cause imbalance)

Logs:

title: Orders Stay Alive Past Time Limit on GateIO
body: ### Describe the bug I run `pmm_dynamic` on gate-io TLOS-USDT. I set the `time-limit` to 60 seconds. At some point the bot fails to cancel individual orders, and they stay alive past the time-limit. The corresponding executors seem to be terminated though. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Spin up HB docker v2.0.0. 2. Create script-config with `pmm_dynamic_config.yml` for GateIO TLOS-USDT and start it. 3. Wait 1-2 hrs. ### Release version 2.0.0 ### Type of installation Docker ### Attach required files [config.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/16332058/config.zip) [logs.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/16332061/logs.zip)

Setup simple pmm controller using mexc

title: Migrate to Pydantic V2

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

body:
### Feature Suggestion

Hummingbot depends on Pydentic v1.10.4 at the moment. This prevents me from using other packages that depend on Pydantic v2.

A global [Environment Upgrade](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/issues/6782) is already planned, so solving this problem may be one of the first steps along the way.

A detailed migration guide is available [here](https://docs.pydantic.dev/latest/migration/), migration can be done in a variety of ways and really smoothly (even maintaining all existing v1-style code).

### Impact

1. Compatibility with other packages
2. Improved performance

title: Chainflip Integration - Bounty Request
body:
### Description

A connector to [Chainflip](chainflip.io) 

Chainflip is a cross-chain DEX built on substrate, supporting native BTC, ETH (USDC and USDT), DOT, FLIP and Arbitrum (ETH.arb and USDC.arb). 

The goal with this connector is to allow retail liquidity providers to conduct both PMMM and XEMM strategies, making markets on Chainflip's variety of pairs. The Chainflip community has been eagerly awaiting the ability to expand liquidity and increase the number of market makers on the protocol and I think a Hummingbot connector is the perfect fit. 

- [Chainflip Docs](https://docs.chainflip.io/concepts/welcome)
- [Chainflip Github](https://github.com/chainflip-io)

### Bounty

- Sponsor: Chainflipgod (humble Chainflip community member) 
- Bounty amount: 1,500,000 HBOT 
- Developer portion: 90% (1.35M HBOT)

**Requirement:** 
1. Integrate to HashKey Global's future market API and push it to Hummingbot.

**Reward:** 
1. Integration Bonus: **2000 USDT**
2. If the hunter meets the requirements of HashKey Group's Talent Program, he/she will have the opportunity to become an official employee of HashKey Group, mainly responsible for technical support and product operation of the API.
3. If the hunter does not meet the requirements of HashKey Group's Talent Program, he/she will have the opportunity to become a quantitative spokesperson for HashKey Group in the Hummingbot community.

title: MACD BB Candle Connector other than USDT on V2
body:
### Describe the bug

I tried to setup the MACD BB Bot, but got the following error:

ValueError: If using all scalar values, you must pass an index

every time i used XXX-USDC or XXX-EUR (xxx = different Coins, like BTC, BNB, ETH und TRX) as trading pair. With XXX-USDT it worked fine, even if that pair was not supported no more (e.g. OKX does not allow USDT trading anymore in my Country).
With the PMM Bot everything worked fine, I could create the USDC Bots

### Steps to reproduce

1. Try to setup an MACD BB Bot
2. Change Candles Trading Pair to one of the following: BTC-USDC; ETH-USDC; TRX-USDC, BTC-EUR; ETH-EUR; TRX-EUR...

title: New Connector Request: Ethereum Classic Network, ETCswap V2
body:
### Description

1.) Chain Connector: Ethereum Classic, Chain 61. https://chainlist.org/chain/61. Add Chain connector guide
2.) AMM-V2 connector: https://v2.etcswap.org A vanilla fork of Uniswap V2. Add V2 connector guide

The primary goal is connect the ETC/USC markets on ETCswap V2 to the ETC/USD CEX markets via Hummingbot XEMM strategy. This is the foundational DeFi pair for Ethereum Classic.

The secondary goal is to have clear guides that allow novice developers in the Ethereum Classic development community open resources for one of the few decentralized networks in blockchain. This is a perfect open source community that deserves Hummingbot support.

Contact: chris@ethereumclassic.com
Protocol Contract List: https://github.com/etcswap

title: Binance - Error Trading on Binance Perpetual Due to New Binance Credits Requirement
body:
### Describe the bug

Hi all,
starting June 26th, Binance Futures traders in the European Economic Area (EEA) must switch to using Binance Credits (BNFCR) for trading. Direct assets for USD-M or COIN-M markets are no longer usable. In the Binance Futures Credits Trading Mode, all USDT or USDC contracts' PNL, margin, and fees will be displayed as Credits labeled BNFCR.

https://www.binance.com/en-BH/support/faq/how-to-use-binance-futures-credits-trading-mode-0e857c392a2d47cebde0af762d9255ae

The error message I encounter in my Hummingbot scripts when trading on binance_perpetual, even though I have enough BNFCR.
Affected countries:
Austria, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, and Slovenia.
Thanks for your help!


### Steps to reproduce

When running any HB script, an error occurs, see log


### Release version

Dashboard (hummingbot/deploy), HB source 1.28.0

### Type of installation

Source

### Attach required files

[log.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/16072792/log.txt)

title: close_position the mininum notional size is different from the open_position
body:
### Describe the bug

when I try to close the position below 5USDT in Binance, I can place an order by the APP but have a question using the hummingbot, the log will return "2024-06-26 12:03:33,508 - 46162 - hummingbot.connector.derivative.binance_perpetual.binance_perpetual_derivative.BinancePerpetualDerivative - WARNING - Sell order notional 2.9995000 is lower than the minimum notional size 5. The order will not be created. Increase the amount or the price to be higher than the minimum notional.".

Actually, Binance can place a close position order below 5USDT.

### Steps to reproduce

1. place a close position order under 5 USDT, will return the warning.
2. I use the below code:
```python
close_position_oc = OrderCandidate(
            # trading_pair=self.trading_pair,
            trading_pair='ENA-USDC',
            is_maker=True,
            order_type=self.order_type,
            order_side=self.trade_sell,
            amount=Decimal(5),
            price=Decimal(0.6),
        )
        self.order_id = self.place_order(self.exchange_name, close_position_oc, self.close_action)


    def place_order(self, connector_name: str, order: OrderCandidate, action: PositionAction):
        self.notify(f"下单信息如下: {order}")
        if action == self.open_action and order.order_side == self.trade_buy:
            self.notify(f"✅ place_order buy open")
            res = self.buy(connector_name=connector_name, trading_pair=order.trading_pair, amount=order.amount,
                           order_type=order.order_type, price=order.price, position_action=self.open_action)
        elif action == self.close_action and order.order_side == self.trade_buy:
            self.notify(f"✅ place_order buy close")
            res = self.buy(connector_name=connector_name, trading_pair=order.trading_pair, amount=order.amount,
                           order_type=order.order_type, price=order.price, position_action=self.close_action)

        elif action == self.open_action and order.order_side == self.trade_sell:
            self.notify(f"✅ place_order sell open")
            res = self.sell(connector_name=connector_name, trading_pair=order.trading_pair, amount=order.amount,
                           order_type=order.order_type, price=order.price, position_action=self.open_action)
        elif action == self.close_action and order.order_side == self.trade_sell:
            self.notify(f"✅ place_order sell close")
            res = self.sell(connector_name=connector_name, trading_pair=order.trading_pair, amount=order.amount,
                           order_type=order.order_type, price=order.price, position_action=self.close_action)
        return res
```


### Release version

1.28.0

### Type of installation

Source

### Attach required files

_No response_

title: Kraken - Delay on fetching balance causing failed to submit orders
body:
### Describe the bug

When running long term bot for Kraken, observed that there are instances of failed to submit orders due to insufficient balance. Reviewed log file and noticed that after the previous order canceled, the connector seems to have failed to update causing the balance not updated and insufficient for the next order cycle

See recording below, the connector also able to recover after the set refresh time (60s) and placed orders successfully but then again happens on other instances
- https://www.loom.com/share/86d19399261a4887b6b54625f38ed756

Ran tests on v2 strategy using `market_making.pmm_simple`
![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/73840223/d39af30e-4a99-4060-b059-8ad8f4db401d)
 - The script should be able to place 2 order levels but same issue happened on earlier tests that it failed to update the balance causing spam on logs `not enough budget..`



### Steps to reproduce

1.  Setup v1 or v2 strategy using kraken 
2. Start and observe order creation would return failed or incomplete due to balance insufficient


### Release version

dev-1.29.0

### Type of installation

Source

### Attach required files


https://drive.google.com/drive/u/0/folders/1RK0ZKo3lRfpcfu_8IkLpjDfoDcWb85Kq

title: Binance - The WS connection was closed unexpectedly. Close code = 1008 msg data: 1008
body:
### Describe the bug

We have been observing this behavior on Binance connector and added below the occurences when tested on v1/v2 strategies:

- Ran tests on Binance spot w/ single order level with refresh time of 1hr
    - After 16mins `WS connection was closed..` occurred and reconnections after 10-20ms
    - Occurred on random timeframe 2mins, 14mins, etc..
- Ran tests on Binance spot on 30mins refresh time
    - `2024-04-05 13:58:06,282` start command initialized
    - `2024-04-05 14:10:18,276` The websocket connection was closed (The WS connection was closed unexpectedly. Close code = 1008 msg data: 1008)
    - After 12mins web socket error occurred
- Ran tests on Binance perpetuals with refresh time of 15s
    - `2024-04-05 13:28:51,879` start command initiated
    - `2024-04-05 13:45:22,886` WARNING - The websocket connection was closed (The WS connection was closed unexpectedly. Close code = 1008 msg data: 1008)
    - There is a 17mins gap
    - Compared to the earlier test, it happened on a longer intervals
- Ran test on a v2 script using binance perpetual as candles
    - `2024-04-05 22:52:10,528` start
    - `2024-04-05 23:22:32,484`  The websocket connection was closed (The WS connection was closed unexpectedly. Close code = 1008 msg data: 1008)
    - This time the gap is around 30mins but add the factor of sudden network issue since im running the test locally
- When regression tests on staging and running trend_follower_v1 and got this behavior, it caused `unhandled error in background task 'BBP_200.2.0'` then the `status --live` stopped

title: funding_rate_arb - stuck on "Take profit profitability reached, stopping executors"
body:
### Describe the bug

When testing funding_rate_arb, observed that when the executor successfully close a position and at the same time triggered the `profitability_to_take_profit` the script tends to continue creating market order to close the position in favor of take profit 

![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/73840223/e2b26a03-8268-4b06-9c62-ac9b5411a1e9)
- Got opportunity for best combination on FET-USDT
    - Placed and filled market sell order on HPL
    - Unable to place order on OKX perpetual due to insufficient balance (another bot was running when the test happened)
        - Script tries to retry until 11/10 then recognized that it needs to close the executor
        - Eventually closed on order id `0x7fa2409ff253284bd5f5a85ea3241c54`
        - At the same time the script triggered the  `Take profit profitability reached, stopping executors` which creates market orders to close order in favor of Take profit
 - Script begun to start creating market buy orders to close executor in favor of take profit on HPL:
    - The orders completed are recognised to close the executor but on exchange these are to open positions
    - The script continues to create/filled and the orders completed append until it reached `30 FET` (`5 FET` ea order filled), see attached from HPL csv file
      ![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/73840223/4869b417-584a-4578-b161-9497b7d2b974)
    - After than it is now spammed by `Take profit profitability reached, stopping executors`
        - It stopped after getting the funding payment rate on HPL

### Steps to reproduce

1.  Setup a simple funding_rate_arb script using HPL and other perpetual connector 
2. On the tests, we set the other perpetual connector with insufficient balance so it do retries until it close the executor. At the same time it opens opportunity for trade profitability to be reached
3. Observe when take profit profitability is reached and 11/10 retries (then it creates market order to close executor)


### Release version

dev-1.28.0

### Type of installation

Source

### Attach required files

[05222024.zip](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/files/15405108/05222024.zip)

- Client stuck on `Winding down..` had to use `exit` command

2. Setup a config with low `total_amount_quote` or `order_interval: 15` 
3. Start the script, expected that script will automatically stop due to insufficient or need to increase order amount or interval

dev-1.28.0

Source

title: DmanV3 script not cleaning up all pending orders after close on HyperLiquid
body:
### Describe the bug

This is tested on the 1.28 development using HyperLiquid

While having the script running I've noticed that some orders of the previous executor are still present on the exchange. See attached screens of Hummingbot status and exchange graph.

When these "ghost orders" are hit and filled they are not taken into account by the Hummingbot script. Resulting in a difference in active amount and finally in a partial closure with a left over active order.

I'm not sure what the philosophy behind the scripts is, but it looks like it is only taking in account the actions from the script itself. Now that this bug is active it's not correcting itself with the actual data from the exchange. In my opinion the script should be based on the actual values on the exchange instead of its own interpretation of it.
Now the script has a 'filled_amount_quote' of 321 USD and the exchange has a "Position Value" of 451 USD.

### Steps to reproduce

1. create script and controller config using dman_v3 with 3 controllers (not sure whether this amount could be related)
2. let it run for a while
3. notice leftover orders still in the system of Hummingbot and exchange


### Release version

dev-1.28.0

### Type of installation

Docker

### Attach required files

![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/2894692/3ef6d62d-d462-4244-b3dd-08df77d476b1)
![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/2894692/5070520e-da6f-4e4c-941e-440070face50)

title: XEMM - Order created late and not recognized by the executor
body:
### Describe the bug

When checking a reported issue on discord and ran tests on XEMM (v2 strategy), found out that a scenario where the connector OrderCreatedEvent is late and scrip fails to recognized. The difference on the time where the order is placed, created and cancelled are too fast the executor failed to catch up causing failed to cancel and order stuck on exchange (eventually filled). 

Here's sample scenario on the attached log:
1. Creating order XEKWYICXBXPUT61854d86431df6c7d
    ```
    2024-05-13 20:15:47,028 - 52696 - hummingbot.strategy.script_strategy_base - INFO - Creating XRP-USDT buy order: price: 0.5041158849945732609768130242 amount: 29.61208172934557299378146284.
    2024-05-13 20:15:47,028 - 52696 - hummingbot.strategy_v2.executors.xemm_executor.xemm_executor - INFO - Created maker order x-XEKWYICXBXPUT61854d86431df6c7d at price 0.5041158849945732609768130242.
    ```
2. Canceling order 
    ```
      2024-05-13 20:15:48,029 - 52696 - hummingbot.strategy_v2.executors.xemm_executor.xemm_executor - INFO - Trade profitability -0.001099891465219536260483473113 is below minimum profitability. Cancelling order.
      2024-05-13 20:15:48,030 - 52696 - hummingbot.strategy.script_strategy_base - INFO - (XRP-USDT) Canceling the limit order x-XEKWYICXBXPUT61854d86431df6c7d. [clock=2024-05-13 12:15:48+00:00]
      # trimmed timestamps
      2024-05-13 20:15:52,669 - 52696 - hummingbot.connector.exchange.binance.binance_exchange.BinanceExchange - WARNING - Failed to cancel order x-XEKWYICXBXPUT61854d86431df6c7d (order not found)
      # trimmed timestamps
      2024-05-13 20:16:00,128 - 52696 - hummingbot.connector.client_order_tracker - INFO - Created LIMIT BUY order x-XEKWYICXBXPUT61854d86431df6c7d for 29.00000000 XRP-USDT.
      2024-05-13 20:16:00,133 - 52696 - hummingbot.core.event.event_reporter - EVENT_LOG - {"timestamp": NaN, "type": "OrderType.LIMIT", "trading_pair": "XRP-USDT", "amount": "29.00000000", "price": "0.50410000", "order_id": "x-XEKWYICXBXPUT61854d86431df6c7d", "creation_timestamp": 1715602545.0, "exchange_order_id": "6163310929", "leverage": 1, "position": "NIL", "event_name": "BuyOrderCreatedEvent", "event_source": "binance"}
    ```
      - The time diff from where the maker order is created and a trade profitability was triggered then cancellation of order is too small and fast
      - The XEMM executor proceed with canceling the order but failed since its still not complete created yet
      - The connector order event completed only after the order was being cancelled
- Orders stuck on the exchange:
  ![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/73840223/4142e72f-2347-4a60-8259-fad3788d7e21)
    - The orders on the exchange are accumulated causing the bot not able to place order due to insufficient balance 
      ```

      Traceback (most recent call last):
      ```

title: kraken - Telegram chat flooded with rate limit messages
body:
### Describe the bug

When running a strategy that uses the `kraken` connector, and `telegram_enabled`, the telegram chat is flooded with messages relating to API rate limit.

For instance, the messages read:

```
(2024-04-29 15:19:55) API rate limit on /0/public/Ticker (1 calls per 1s) has almost reached. Limits used is 1 in the last 1 seconds
```

The current rate at which I am seeing these messages is somewhere along the lines of 2/minute.

### Steps to reproduce

1. modify `scripts/fixed_grid.py` to use kraken connector
2. setup telegram integration
3. start bot using the modified `fixed_grid.py` script


### Release version

1.27.0

### Type of installation

Docker

### Attach required files

_No response_

title: AscendEX - Order tracking issue
body: ### Describe the bug I am encountering an issue where I receive a MarketOrderFailureEvent event, indicating a failure in order processing. However, despite this event, the order is actually being created successfully. This issue occurs exclusively on AscendEX. ### Steps to reproduce 1. run a mm bot 2. leave it for a day 3. after a day, log into the exchange and review all active orders. Check for any orders that exceed the maximum order age. 4. review the logs for any MarketOrderFailureEvent to identify any discrepancies between the bot's reported failures and actual order statuses on the exchange. ### Release version 1.26 ### Type of installation Docker ### Attach required files ![Bildschirmfoto 2024-04-28 um 08 37 53](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/99398085/12fa3d73-b21f-461f-be99-112d66978fb2) ![Bildschirmfoto 2024-04-28 um 08 39 25](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/99398085/15b12cfc-6700-43a8-b9e4-a3de2887c623) ![Bildschirmfoto 2024-04-28 um 08 42 22](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/99398085/d2e8fc5d-517b-487c-b7a0-1be1d1a241c2) ids of the "failed" orders: HMBotBXDUT48a2769e4c47 HMBotSXDUTdb1dfbe42367 HMBotSXDUT4922fc1819f1 the log file: [logs_conf_XCAD.log](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/files/15141094/logs_conf_XCAD.log)

title: V2 strategy - support for creating separate controller log files

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

body:
### Feature Suggestion

When testing v2 strategy using multiple controller configs, we observed that the log file is shared and its difficult to read or trace logs for a particular controller without looking into other controller events. This would also cause increase on the size of log files specially when hit by an issue or exchange related problems.


### Impact

So when you create a script config with multiple controllers like below:

```
markets: {}
candles_config: []
controllers_config:
# - conf_directional_trading.bollinger_v1_1.yml
- conf_directional_trading.trend_follower_v1_1.yml
- conf_directional_trading.dman_v3_1.yml
- conf_market_making.dman_maker_1.yml
config_update_interval: 60
script_file_name: v2_generic_with_controllers.py
```

Instead of sharing all logs inside the script file name `v2_generic_with_controllers.log`,  create log files that point to each of controller yml files, e.g `conf_market_making.dman_maker_1.log`

### Additional context

_No response_

title: Perpetual connectors - Getting order failed or error when using leverage beyond exchange limit
body:
### Describe the bug

When running tests on funding rate arb script on development, observed that when using two exchanges with same market sometimes exceeds the leverage resulting order failure and errors. Therefore we run the same test on the following perpetual connectors:

- For Binance and Kucoin, when leverage is beyond the exchange’s limit it will return an error that `..is not valid` or `..cannot exceed` causing failure to order creation
- For Okx, Gateio and Hyperliquid, Returns error `..exceeds maximum limit` and `..leverage to high` then creates order with leverage set to either `1` or `10`
- For Vega, it automatically adjust the leverage and use it when placing orders ✅

Suggestion: We think that it should copy what Vega do when exceeding leverage, uses the maximum possible value then place order.


### Steps to reproduce

1. Setup v1 strategy (perp-mm) and use any perpetual connector 
2. Select any market and check the leverage, then set a value higher that the exchange can support
   - for sample on Kucoin perpetual, GAS-USDT can only be set up to 5x but other exchanges has 50x
4. Start the strategy and observe behavior when exceed leverage and order creation on logs  


### Release version

dev-1.27.0, v1.26.0

### Type of installation

Source

### Attach required files

n/a

title: Vega - Create and cancel order at the same time
body:
### Describe the bug

When checking Vega connector, there was an instance where it created an order and also cancel at the same time. Client seem to not recognize this event causing order stuck on cancelation event when reaching set `time_limit` when using `v2 strategies (dman_v3)`

![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/73840223/c0d52731-f761-4b09-b658-a953843b0978)
- Observe that the script created order ok at `2024-04-03 14:16:20,676`
- Checked [vega explorer](https://explorer.vega.xyz/parties/d47393b7a742dd14eb1bf067522084632944cdbee0da80b30f16d98c3f9fafac)
    - Observed that at the same timeframe the order also got cancelled, see exchange id `ce9812471142cce4515d68f1691f36dea4cb2883f359a32be7d1e0bf7c2c0e9c` and `VGHBSETUT61531dd904f0a9e9d083c03` on [link](https://explorer.vega.xyz/txs/0xB076049EDC3911575C756BC6D5B3EC1639001F52B8248590B01C9397D4A9B41F) , block `41875043`
    - The script reaches the set time_limit, observed that it is stuck on canceling the `VGHBSETUT61531dd904f0a9e9d083c03`
        - On Vega explorer, it return an error of no order found in the market see [link here](https://explorer.vega.xyz/txs/0xBC8384E6A5A0138B7FDCD1A9539ACCC5345EBE086E5B132D0ABBADC7F31B1B36)
        - This seems to be expected since the order has been already cancelled

Another instance:
![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/73840223/82dd5ad9-bd8d-42d8-8883-38b6ed56a156)
![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/73840223/94c2a422-4814-435a-910f-383caa873996)
- Order in screenshot is `VGHBSETUT61532358805f19e9d083c03` and exchange id `da8528a450965dfeab615cef57a6dbc35a4cbfa9e9da1492d0c254ec53127350`
- See [cancellation order link](https://explorer.vega.xyz/txs/0xCDF0BA6801D64A2C809B49BD65C2BC34FC7DDAD37CB9FBD58FADAC83955448F9)

body:

In _all_trade_updates_for_order of binance_exchange.py, the symbol is assigned in trading_pair field of TradeUpdate class. Btw, the symbol(BTCUSDT) and trading_pair(BTC-USDT) are different in binance. 

![1709630015759](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/97663984/2c67171d-8793-4d4a-a83f-883bc34f12be)



### Steps to reproduce

1. It works well right now
2. Some errors will occur if using the trading_pair field in TradeUpdate class to implement some logics in the future.



### Release version

v1.25.0

### Type of installation

Source

### Attach required files

_No response_

title: Unhandled error in background task: Odd-length string
body:
### Describe the bug

After running Hummingbot, as the first message on the log pane, I see the following error.

`async_utils - Unhandled error in background task: Odd-length string (See log file for stack trace dump)`

### Steps to reproduce

1. Build from source
2. ./start
3. Observe log pane

### Release version

1.24.0

### Type of installation

Source

### Attach required files

[logs_hummingbot.log](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/files/14181460/logs_hummingbot.log)

title: Gate io perpetual - Failed to CLOSE position using Dman-v3 strategy
body:
### Describe the bug

Start d-man-v3 strategy using gate-io-perpetual as exchange, 
After order to OPEN filled wait for trailing stop or stop-loss activate order to CLOSE.
After order filled review on exchange that client actually OPEN another position with market order. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Clone latest development (or 1.24.0 release)
2. Edit the v2_dman_v3_multiple_pairs script to use exchange = "gate_io_perpetual", candles_exchange = "binance_perpetual"
3. connect gate_io_perpetual
4. start the script

Actual: 
Client failed to close position and opened another position instead of CLOSE


### Release version

1.24.0

### Type of installation

Source

### Attach required files

[logs_v2_dman_v3_multiple_pairsgate.log.2024-01-29.log](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/files/14130229/logs_v2_dman_v3_multiple_pairsgate.log.2024-01-29.log)
[v2_dman_v3_multiple_pairsgate.py.txt](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/files/14130230/v2_dman_v3_multiple_pairsgate.py.txt)

title: Config Scripts - Autocomplete issue with --conf parameter prevents script startup
body:
### Describe the bug

There is a bug with the configurable scripts where using the `--conf` parameter causes an autocomplete feature to activate. This issue occurs specifically when the default configuration filename begins with "conf" (e.g., "conf_strategy_name.yml"). When typing a command like `start --script v2_strategy_config.py --conf`, the autocomplete pop-up is triggered immediately after `--conf` is input, and when selecting the config file it appends the filename to the parameter leading to a prevention of the script from starting up as expected.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Ensure there is at least one configuration file in the directory whose name starts with "conf".
2. Launch HB.
3. Type the command `start --script any_v2_config_strategy.py --conf`
4. Observe that the autocomplete pop-up is triggered immediately after `--conf`
5. Select the config file and observe an error in the log and the script is unable to start


### Release version

dev-1.24.0

### Type of installation

Source

### Attach required files

title: Basic Modules Upgrade: Research and Bounty Initiative
body:
For the comprehensive upgrade of Hummingbot's basic modules, we are adopting a two-phase approach:

1. **Research Phase:** Initially, we will embark on an extensive research phase to identify all potential improvements across the fundamental modules of Hummingbot, which include configuration, client, Telegram integration, remote interface, security, and database models. This phase is crucial for understanding the current state of these modules and pinpointing areas where enhancements can yield significant benefits.
2. **Bounty Creation:** Following the research phase, we will systematically create bounties for each identified task. This approach not only allows us to tackle each improvement in a focused and efficient manner but also opens up opportunities for community involvement. By leveraging the collective expertise and creativity of the community, we can implement innovative solutions that align with our objectives of optimizing and securing Hummingbot.

title: Environment Upgrade
body:
As part of our commitment to maintaining a cutting-edge platform, we're undertaking significant updates to our environment:

1. **Dependency Optimization:** We will meticulously review and eliminate any unnecessary dependencies, ensuring a streamlined and efficient environment.
2. **Upgrade Blockers Assessment:** A thorough analysis will be conducted to create a detailed summary of obstacles impeding the upgrade of our libraries to their latest versions. This proactive approach will facilitate a smoother transition during updates.
3. **Python 3.11 Migration:** In keeping with technological advancements, we plan to upgrade our systems to Python 3.11. This update will leverage the latest features and improvements offered by this new version, enhancing the performance and capabilities of Hummingbot.
4. **Library Dependencies Update:** To align with the latest standards, we will upgrade the dependencies of our libraries. This process includes modifying any deprecated code, ensuring compatibility and harnessing the advancements in these libraries for optimal performance and security.

title: Connectors Development
body:
In our quest to continually refine Hummingbot, we're focusing on elevating our connectors' efficiency and functionality. This year, we plan to upgrade our silver connectors, aligning them with the latest standards derived from our comprehensive quarterly connector polls. Additionally, we're excited to introduce new perpetual connectors, including a notable addition for OKX.

Crucial to this initiative is the development of a detailed, configurable specification for all connectors. This specification will delineate key operational parameters such as the frequency of RESTful requests for updating orders, funding rates, and other vital data. By standardizing and optimizing these aspects, we aim to enhance the performance and reliability of Hummingbot connectors, ultimately providing a more robust and seamless trading experience for our users.

title: AI-Powered User Experience
body:
We are excited to incorporate AI functionalities to improve the overall user experience. These AI features will assist in various aspects such as:

1. **Custom Codebase Explanations:** AI will provide tailored explanations of the codebase, making it more accessible to users of all skill levels.
2. **Error Log Analysis and Report Submission:** AI will review error logs, submit reports, and provide insights for troubleshooting.
3. **Script Configuration and Bot Deployment Assistance:** AI will guide users through the process of creating script configurations and deploying new bots, simplifying these complex tasks.

title: Enhanced Strategy V2 Framework
body:
The Strategy V2 framework has been a game-changer, and we are committed to expanding its capabilities. Our focus will be on adding more smart components and executor handlers, which will offer increased flexibility and efficiency in strategy implementation. Key additions include:

1. **XEMM Component:** This component will allow users to place a limit order on one exchange and, upon its fulfillment, hedge the order at market price on another exchange.
2. **DCA Component:** Designed for dynamic trading, this component will manage multiple open orders with a global take profit and stop loss.
3. **Statistical Arbitrage Component:** Utilizing two position executors, this component will close the compound position when it turns positive, optimizing the arbitrage opportunities.
4. **Grid Component**: Using multiple position executors to create a grid. The grid will offer configurable orders distributions using the Distributions module.

title: Community-Driven HUB
body:
A new HUB is in the works where our community can upload and share scripts and configurations. This HUB will enable users to easily pull these resources from anywhere, fostering a collaborative and resource-rich environment.

The MVP will provide an API that will let you:

- Upload a new script
- Upload a new config
- Pull a script
- Pull a config

The development of the private scripts is not going to be supported initially but we are open to working with devs that are interested in this feature. Also, you can deploy the hub locally or in a server to keep your strategies and configs secret.
We think that this project will elevate the collaboration between Hummingbot users and will simplify the deployment process.

title: Controllers for External Signal Integration
body:
We plan to introduce controllers that can receive signals from external services. This enhancement will transform Hummingbot into a more extensive product, capable of streaming signals from various external platforms, thereby broadening the scope of trading strategies and market responsiveness.

To accomplish this task we are going to create two base controllers:

- Directional Trading: receives the signal from another service. The value of the signal will determine if it's time to open a long or a short executor.
- Market Making: receives the reference price (shifted mid-price) and the spread multiplier.

The configuration of the bot will be defined with a config file, so the user can set up the parameters like the order amount, leverage and so locally while they are using the signal from another service. This will introduce collaboration between Hummingbot users and a kind of copy trading bounded by the logic of the controllers.

title: Configurable Scripts
body: The development of configurable scripts is already underway. This feature will allow for easy deployment and customization of complex strategies, significantly simplifying the user experience while maintaining the sophistication of the strategies.

title: Kucoin perpetual - Unable to place open orders after successfully closing a previous open position
body:
### Describe the bug

When testing kucoin perpetual using. v2 strategies, we focused on the connector behavior when open/close position using dmanv3. Setup a simple dmanv3 script:
- Use binance perpetual for candles feed
- Focus on 2 order levels,
- Timelimit set to 120s and tight start, TP and SL spreads. 

Observed that connector was able to placed and cancel order successfully when reached refresh time. On this test:
- We are able to get our first filled order that opened a position then waited until it reaches the set time limit. 
- After reaching the time limit, the connector began to place order again however this time the script was flooded with `Error submitting order...The price of the position increase order cannot be greater (when short) or lower (when long) than the position liquidation price.`

Source

title: kucoin connector unexpected cancel
body: ### Describe the bug I've encountered an odd issue that's been persisting for a while. Occasionally, when placing a market order, only part of it gets filled before the order is abruptly cancelled. I've overlooked this until now, but it's becoming inconvenient as I have to frequently adjust my inventory for the unfilled portions. this only happens on kucoin. ### Steps to reproduce 1. place market order at kucoin 2. it will give some filled amount for some orders eg 1/121 3. it will say created order 4. it will cancel the order half filled. ### Release version 1.21 ### Type of installation Docker ### Attach required files

title: Error when using simple xemm script on gate.io
body:
### Describe the bug

When running the script simple xemm on IOTA-FDUSD on binance (maker) and IOTA-USDT on gate (taker)
when type status, getting the error that IOTA-USDT book doesn't exist for gate.io which isnt true. 
(it seems that on gate it returns as IOTA_USDT trading pair instead of IOTA-USDT but if I change the "taker_pair" to IOTA_USDT the script just doesnt start) 
It is also not sending taker orders on Gate (as hedge, as it should be) and even calculating different pricing for a maker order executed on the same price but just small difference in time (a few ms)
![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/110646050/ae4158bd-3be1-4cc4-995f-8d75fda29419)
![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/110646050/b0146332-e443-420d-9d06-d94a9cc77f0c)
![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/110646050/ba2c5a5f-3582-4738-96e4-7696297467e2)



### Steps to reproduce

1. run the script simple xemm on gate.io as taker
2. type status 
3. wait until maker orders are filled and see how taker orders are not going through on gate.io as it should


### Release version

1.22.0

### Type of installation

Source

### Attach required files

[logs_simple_xemm_example.log](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/files/13814631/logs_simple_xemm_example.log)

### Feature Suggestion

https://docs.bitfinex.com/docs/ws-websocket-checksum

We can mitigate potential errors and losses by ensuring the synchronization of order books.

title: Injective  - Unexpected error while running the transactions check process
body:
### Describe the bug

When running test on injective spot exchange, we observed that there are instances of the connector creating orders returned `unexpected error while running the transaction check process`

```

2023-12-22 11:46:39,005 - 16886 - hummingbot.strategy.pure_market_making.pure_market_making - INFO - (INJ-USDT) Creating 1 bid orders at (Size, Price): ['0.5 INJ, 39.52 USDT']
2023-12-22 11:46:39,006 - 16886 - hummingbot.strategy.pure_market_making.pure_market_making - INFO - (INJ-USDT) Creating 1 ask orders at (Size, Price): ['0.5 INJ, 39.583 USDT']
2023-12-22 11:46:47,056 - 16886 - hummingbot.connector.exchange.injective_v2.injective_v2_exchange.InjectiveV2Exchange - ERROR - Unexpected error while running the transactions check process
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/rapcomia/github/hummingbot/staging/hummingbot/connector/exchange/injective_v2/injective_v2_exchange.py", line 905, in _check_orders_transactions
    await asyncio.shield(task)
  File "/Users/rapcomia/github/hummingbot/staging/hummingbot/connector/exchange/injective_v2/injective_v2_exchange.py", line 927, in _check_orders_creation_transactions
    order_updates = await self._data_source.order_updates_for_transaction(
  File "/Users/rapcomia/github/hummingbot/staging/hummingbot/connector/exchange/injective_v2/data_sources/injective_grantee_data_source.py", line 357, in order_updates_for_transaction
    transaction_data = str(base64.b64decode(transaction_info["data"]["data"]))
KeyError: 'data'
```

Client is stuck on this behavior and orders are active but not on exchange 
![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/73840223/79d675d9-5975-46cd-88a2-4d766e8cf749)
![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/73840223/b36bde46-525c-4b36-890c-696ec1897ba3)

Waited for couple more minutes and ended up with `There was a problem updating order... (order not found).`
```
2023-12-22 11:59:51,001 - 16886 - hummingbot.strategy.pure_market_making.pure_market_making - INFO - (INJ-USDT) Canceling the limit order BIJUT60d11311fba0c7ae57bd8df4233d974642083223cfcf0. [clock=2023-12-22 03:59:51+00:00]
2023-12-22 11:59:51,002 - 16886 - hummingbot.strategy.pure_market_making.pure_market_making - INFO - (INJ-USDT) Canceling the limit order SIJUT60d11311fbab67ae57bd8df4233d974642083223cfcf0. [clock=2023-12-22 03:59:51+00:00]
2023-12-22 12:00:01,083 - 16886 - hummingbot.connector.exchange.injective_v2.injective_v2_exchange.InjectiveV2Exchange - WARNING - Error fetching status update for the active order BIJUT60d11311fba0c7ae57bd8df4233d974642083223cfcf0: There was a problem updating order BIJUT60d11311fba0c7ae57bd8df4233d974642083223cfcf0 (order not found).
2023-12-22 12:00:01,084 - 16886 - hummingbot.connector.exchange.injective_v2.injective_v2_exchange.InjectiveV2Exchange - WARNING - Error fetching status update for the active order SIJUT60d11311fbab67ae57bd8df4233d974642083223cfcf0: There was a problem updating order SIJUT60d11311fbab67ae57bd8df4233d974642083223cfcf0 (order not found).
```


### Steps to reproduce

1.  Setup Injective spot on Pure market making
2.  Start the strategy and observe behavior 


### Release version

dev-1.23.0

### Type of installation

Source

### Attach required files

title: New Connector - NFTPerp DEX
body:
### Description

Create a connector to add support for NFTPerp on Hummingbot.

NFTPerp has a Javascript SDK and various example repos on github to reflect all its platform actions. They are linked below:

1) [NFTPerp SDK](https://github.com/nftperp/nftperp-sdk)
2) [Live Trader](https://github.com/nftperp/nftperp-maker/blob/main/liveTrader.js): A library to perform complex actions like creating and canceling bunch of limit orders 
3) [API Docs](https://nftperp.readme.io/reference/nftperp-v2-apis)
4) [Protocol Documentation](https://nftperp.gitbook.io/core-docs/)

NFTPerp is deployed in Arbitrum. The latest contract addresses can be found [here](https://api.nftperp.xyz/contracts). Join the NFTPerp discord channel [here](https://discord.com/invite/nftperp) or contact [me](https://t.me/th1r3een_13) or [0xJose](https://t.me/The0xJose) on Telegram if you have any question. We want to get this done as soon as possible, so if we do not find a developer in a few days, we will take care of this task internally. So DM us before starting

### Bounty

- Sponsor: NFTPerp
- Bounty amount: 4000 USDC
- Developer portion: 3800 USDC

title: Fixed Grid - endless loop of unfulfilled order
body: ### Describe the bug My fixed grid bot closed due to PC upgrade. When I relaunched it - it's trying to send rebalance order that can't be fulfilled by the exchange, thus stuck in an endless loop and not progressing to send the grid orders: Hummingbot screen attached. ### Steps to reproduce 1. 2. 3. ### Release version dev-1.18.0 ### Type of installation Docker ### Attach required files _No response_

title: dYdX perpetual - Orders failed event causing active orders not recognized and stuck on exchange
body:
### Describe the bug

When testing v2 strategy on dYdX perpetual, observed that it ended up`Not enough budget to open position.` when initially it started with multi level orders and no filled event happened. Decided to run again a long term bot using v1 strategy (Perpetual Market making) and left it for couple of hours (9hrs).

Observed that the connector now is stuck on `Insufficient balance...You are also at a possible risk of being liquidated if there happens to be an open loss.` which is expected if you dont have enough balance to post orders on exchange.

![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/73840223/ca4e9c0e-8051-42e1-b206-771ebc07225b)
- Noticed that the available balance is at negative
- While this happened, there are orders that are stuck on exchange. Even `stop` command does not recognized these orders
   ![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/73840223/2ad23762-fb4c-4030-a419-531efc332230)
     - Review log file and found out upon creating orders, got a order failed event resulting to connector not recognize it and left on exchange as active
        - 2023-12-14 13:22:02,002 Created buy orders
            - Creating buy order 14.470 HummingbotBLKUD60c7176aabdffed184d098c22
            - Creating buy order 14.617 HummingbotBLKUD60c7176aabdc7ed184d098c22
        - 2023-12-14 13:22:02,778 Order update failed for HummingbotBLKUD60c7176aabdffed184d098c22
        - 2023-12-14 13:22:02,775 Order update failed for HummingbotBLKUD60c7176aabdc7ed184d098c22
        - 2023-12-14 13:23:02,004 Reached set order refresh time (60s) but these orders are not canceled

title: Kucoin - Use multiplex Websocket connections

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

body: ### Feature Suggestion Websocket connexions thru Kucoin trading / futures API is limited to 50. After, you get an error: Particulary when using a lot of HB instances (i'm running 40 and i need around 100) ### Impact Is there a way to implement WS multiplex tunnels (1 for SPOT and 1 for FUTURES as an example). Or any way allowing to have more WS connexions. Are other CEX facing the same limitations ? ### Additional context Using spot_perpetual_arbitrage strategy ### Ideas Perhaps a mecanism to proxy WS requests when using multiple instances with the same strategy. To get balances / prices in a global way so all strategies can share the same info and then it doesn't require every strat to open it's own WS connexions, only the sell/buy orders and orders state connexions. or Using your Market Data Collector function then mod the spot_perp_arbitrage script to use it. - Does it use websocket ? - Can be polled every 1 sec ? - Can it make the data available to other strategies ?

title: XxxOrderCreatedEvent is not triggered when limit order gets completely filled immediately after placement
body:
### Describe the bug

I'm testing `miner_script.py` from #6600 and got an error when the bot is unable to place TakeProfit order because it's amount is 0. This issue is not specific for the PR change however.

The logic flow is the following:

1. `PositionExecutor` first creating open order via `place_open_order()`
1. It then expects order creation event to assign order via `get_in_flight_order()`:
```python
    def process_order_created_event(self, _, market, event: Union[BuyOrderCreatedEvent, SellOrderCreatedEvent]):
        if self.open_order.order_id == event.order_id:
            self.open_order.order = self.get_in_flight_order(self.exchange, event.order_id)
```
3. When order completion event is coming ( `process_order_completed_event()`), take profit order creation logic is triggered. Here, order amount is `amount=self.open_order.executed_amount_base,`. 

The issue: when `XxxOrderCreatedEvent` event is not coming, `self.open_order.order` assignment is not happening. 0 amount is returned from `TrackedOrder`:
```python
    @property
    def executed_amount_base(self):
        if self.order:
            return self.order.executed_amount_base
        else:
            return Decimal("0")  # <----- this
```

The fix I made locally:


```python
diff --git a/hummingbot/connector/client_order_tracker.py b/hummingbot/connector/client_order_tracker.py
index 77d02df4b..193cff4dd 100644
--- a/hummingbot/connector/client_order_tracker.py
+++ b/hummingbot/connector/client_order_tracker.py
@@ -390,7 +390,10 @@ class ClientOrderTracker:
         )
 
     def _trigger_order_creation(self, tracked_order: InFlightOrder, previous_state: OrderState, new_state: OrderState):
-        if previous_state == OrderState.PENDING_CREATE and new_state == OrderState.OPEN:
+        if previous_state == OrderState.PENDING_CREATE and new_state in (OrderState.OPEN,
+                                                                         OrderState.PARTIALLY_FILLED,
+                                                                         OrderState.FILLED,
+                                                                         OrderState.COMPLETED):
             self.logger().info(tracked_order.build_order_created_message())
             self._trigger_created_event(tracked_order)

```

### Steps to reproduce

1. 
2. 
3. 


### Release version

c0133082cb3b432b9c195b6136a4c11e5eb88f79

### Type of installation

Docker

### Attach required files

_No response_

title: Use execution exchange not candles exchange for `get_close_price`

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

body:
### Feature Suggestion

`get_close_price` in ControllerBase uses the last candle from candles feed to fetch the price:
https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/blob/master/hummingbot/smart_components/strategy_frameworks/controller_base.py#L52C9-L52C9

However, since this is used to set spreads in MarketMakingController, I think it should use the get_mid_price function so that it uses the most up to date price data, similar to ScriptStrategyBase.

Also, if the user uses a different exchange for candles than execution, this function doesn't work since it looks for candles at `self.config.exchange`



### Impact

More correct

### Additional context

_No response_

title: Binance perpetual - Order failed due to "ReduceOnly Order is rejected"
body:
### Describe the bug

When reviewing long term bots for stop-loss behavior on Binance perpetual, we observed that the connector tries to create two stop-loss order. Reviewed log files and noticed that it successfully creates the order while the other is failed. Reproduced by creating a config that focuses on stop-loss and observed:

![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/73840223/a7cfea75-10c9-4abe-866b-01ad87e5f732)
![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/73840223/d7b36636-5742-48e8-9386-c105fbf1181e)
- On the screenshot above, the client displays a duplicate of the open position while on the exchange it does not
- The issue occurred when using position mode `Hedge`, not happening on `One-way`
  - After successfully open a SHORT position, the client tries to create 1 bid order to close
  - Then the next order cycle, it displayed a duplicate of the open position (does not seem to affect the exchange)
  - Then the next order cycle, it tries to create two bid stop loss orders but it only recognize one of them and the other has failed
  - Repeat itself on the cycle of orders


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a simple Perpetual Market-Making strategy on `Binance perpetual`
2. Focus the config on creating stop-loss by tightening the `stop-loss-spread`
3. Set position mode to `Hedge`
4. Start the strategy and wait until it opens a position
5. Observe behavior after open a position then creates stop loss orders (after 2 order cycles)
6. Best to run with `status --live` 


### Release version

dev-1.21.0

### Type of installation

Source

### Attach required files

[logs_pmm-binance-02.log](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/files/12912128/logs_pmm-binance-02.log)
[pmm-binance-02.yml.log](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/files/12912133/pmm-binance-02.yml.log) `remove .log`

title: Bitfinex connector fix - Unexpected error occurred when listening to order book streams
body:
### Description

Community needs a fix for Bitfinex, Implement listen_for_subscriptions method in Bitfinex API Order Book DataSource.
The Hummingbot community members reported they want enhance the functionality of the Bitfinex connector by implementing the listen_for_subscriptions method in the BitfinexAPIOrderBookDataSource class, a derived class from OrderBookTrackerDataSource. Currently, this method is not implemented, causing an unexpected error when attempting to listen to order book streams. 
Any community member are free to fund/address this issue, this could be helpful for Bitfinex users, ultimately improving their trading experience on the platform.

title: AMM Price quotes issued with ZERO amounts results in Price Error

labels.name: gateway
labels.description: Related to Gateway module

body:
**Describe the bug**
// A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

In strategies that involved an AMM, hummingbot is issuing price quotes with a ZERO amount which results in an error and prevents the strategy from issuing orders. When this situation occurs, hummingbot reports following notice on logs:

![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/101363554/8848cf06-e066-4a23-b6aa-64dcf9fa1293)


After detail debugging, I was able to narrow down the problem to the ZERO amount on the price request. This screenshot shows gateway response returned when a ZERO amount is provided. It matches the error I saw in the strategy execution.

![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/101363554/eda40767-51e1-4227-8844-2a53e71e8aff)

If the amount is changed to be greater than ZERO (one in this case), the successful response is returned as showed in gateway screenshot.

![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/101363554/74fe3848-f0d1-40ec-9b4e-9c865b20a1a3)

The strategy I am running is XEM using Kraken and Uniswap-Polygon (or Quickswap) when this occurs. The token pair are MATIC/WMATIC and USDT. 

After considerable debugging, I found the parts of the code where the problem occurs. The reasons this occurs are beyond my technical programming capability so why I'm reporting and hoping someone can figure out root cause and provide a fix.

I narrowed down to these two function calls

hummingbot/connector/exchange_base.pyx
    def quantize_order_amount(self, trading_pair: str, amount: Decimal) -> Decimal:
        return self.c_quantize_order_amount(trading_pair, amount)

hummingbot/connector/connector_base.pyx
    cdef object c_quantize_order_amount(self, str trading_pair, object amount, object price=s_decimal_NaN):
        order_size_quantum = self.c_get_order_size_quantum(trading_pair, amount))
        return (amount // order_size_quantum) * order_size_quantum


quantize_order_amount() calls the cdef defined c_quantize_order_amount function. The c_quantize_order_amount function first gets the order_size_quantum value (in my case, the value is always 1E-8) and then uses that value along with amount argument to perform calculation and return the resulting value.

What I found is that if c_quantize_order_amount returns a value of 4 or greater, the strategy works and the price error does not occur. However, when c_quantize_order_amount returns a value less than 4 (3.9, 3, 2, 1, etc), then the value returned does not make it back to the calling quantize_order_amount function. When quantize_order_amount function receives the value, it appears as 0. Hence, that 0 returned value ends up being used in the AMM price quote request.

I put debugging statements in the calling function quantize_order_amount() so I can see what the returned value was that it was getting:

![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/101363554/b483abae-17ea-47c5-ac43-67aced555f36)

In the c_quantize_order_amount function, I put in debugging statements too and and also hardcoded the return value which allowed me to narrow down the issues to the value of 4. In this case, I have the return value hardcoded to 3.9

![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/101363554/9918a6be-9fce-46b4-9743-30dbb105d02e)

When the return value is below 4.0 the problem occurs. As shown, I have the return value hardcoded to 3.9. You can see based on debug statements that when quantize_order_amount() receives the returned value, it is received as a 0 (ZERO):

![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/101363554/ba5cf8b2-7f77-41f6-a9fd-8b16a0b49eeb)

Now I've changed the return value to be 4.0 (anything above 4 works per my testing) in c_quantize_order_amount function as shown:

![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/101363554/feb3107f-bf58-4c18-a719-2bcc92504340)


As the log file show, the value of 4 is properly returned to the calling quantize_order_amount() function as shown:

![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/101363554/13e9d5d0-d92b-43bf-be94-9fdeac4dc966)

A lot happening in the code with the python and cython code intermixed. This is an area I am not familiar with and could not figure out why this behavior is occurring. Hopefully with this info, you can replicate the issue and provide a fix.
Note - I replicated this in a Windows environment as well as Oracle Ubuntu environment.


**Release version**
// Include your bot's version number (Can be found at the upper left corner of your CLI).
Version 1.16.0



**Optional: your discord username:**
cryptoJorge

title: Uniswap-Polygon manual token approvals on different contract address
body:
**Describe the bug**
// A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

When using uniswap-polygon DEX for trading, the BOT does not place orders and provides status message stating markets are not ready.
“cross_exchange_market_making - Markets are not ready. No market making trades are permitted.”

After debugging, found that markets were not ready because allowances call returned one of the tokens did not have any approvals (value of zero returned).

Specifically, the pair I’m using is WMATIC-USDT. As screenshot of Postman call shows, WMATIC has an approval value of 0.00 whereas USDT has value > 0.

![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/101363554/a0491d43-8ccf-4b7a-80b1-09cb0eff70b6)

However, both token pairs were manually approved within uniswap-polygon using metamask.  

Doing a check on polygonscan for my wallet I do see that both tokens have approval for uniswap (https://polygonscan.com/tokenapprovalchecker?search=walletAddress)

However, looking closer on the image, I see that Uniswap-Polygon approvals are on two different contract addresses for USDT and only one of them for WMATIC 

![image](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/assets/101363554/ffd66c7e-5e23-479f-8832-df6ac52ccb25)

The two Uniswap Contract addresses are:

- Uniswap V3: Router 2:		0x68b3465833fb72A70ecDF485E0e4C7bD8665Fc45
- Uniswap Protocol: Permit2:	0x000000000022D473030F116dDEE9F6B43aC78BA3

Therefore, the token approvals per Uniswap contract address are as follows:

- Uniswap V3: Router 2

	USDT

- Uniswap Protocol: Permit2

	USDT
	WMATIC


After analyzing the code, I found that hummingbot is using the Uniswap V3: Router 2 contract address for allowance call as well as many other calls.
./gateway/src/templates/uniswap.yml
contractAddresses:
  mainnet:
    uniswapV3SmartOrderRouterAddress: '0x68b3465833fb72A70ecDF485E0e4C7bD8665Fc45'
    uniswapV3NftManagerAddress: '0xC36442b4a4522E871399CD717aBDD847Ab11FE88'


I did reach out to Uniswap and they stated that Permit2 contract is being used when approvals are done through their app. They provided the following information and blog post for more information:

- “Permit2 is a non-upgradable, unowned, and open-source contract that has been deployed to the same address across Ethereum, Optimism, Arbitrum, Polygon, and Celo. To start integrating, see the developer docs and SDK.”
- Permit2: https://blog.uniswap.org/permit2-and-universal-router


I did some experimentation to see if the fix was as simple as just changing the uniswapV3SmartOrderRouterAddress contract address to the Permit2 one.  The change fixed the allowances issue which prevented “markets from being ready.” Unfortunately it leads to a different issue with the gateway not being able to get pricing:

- 14:42:19 - cross_exchange_market_making - Gateway: failed to obtain order price.No market making order will be submitted.
- 2023-06-13 04:03:17 | error |   Price query failed: priceSwapIn: no trade pair found for [object Object] to [object Object]. ::ffff:127.0.0.1 - - [12/Jun/2023:14:43:17 +0000] "POST /amm/price HTTP/1.1" 500 608 "-" "Python/3.8 aiohttp/3.7.4.post0"


Since Uniswap is a GOLD Dex, I’m hoping I was able to provide enough information for the Hummingbot Foundation to make the proper changes to support how Uniswap is managing approvals. Looks like multiple configurable contract addresses are going to be needed for Uniswap-Polygon for the BOT to properly function.



**Steps To Reproduce**
// A concise description of the **steps to reproduce the buggy behavior**:

Not sure how I ended up with two contract addresses being used for approval of my USDT token. 
However, to reproduce the issue where HummingBot is not able to create any orders because "markets are not ready" because of allowances call, I recommend the following:

1. Add two new tokens to wallet (metamask in my case) on polygon network (e.g., WMATIC and USDT). 
2. Connect to Uniswap-Polygon App
3. Setup a SWAP between the tokens (WMATIC and USDT). In setting up the swap, you'll be asked to "approve" one of the tokens. Approve it
4. Reverse the order of the two tokens in the swap setup window. You'll be asked to "approve" the other token. Approve it.
5. In Hummingbot, create a new strategy that uses Uniswap-Polygon DEX (XEMM or AMM) utilizing those two same tokens.
6. Start the strategy and you'll see message "Markets are not ready. No market making trades are permitted.”

As stated in description, the reason for the Markets not being ready is because of the allowances call returning tokens with a value of 0. You can verify this by following these two steps:

Step 1:  Use Postman with Gateway to place the allowances POST call (https://{{host}}:{{port}}/evm/allowances). You'll see both tokens come back with values of 0
Step 2: Go to polyscan and check what contract Uniswap-Polygon used for your token approvals (https://polygonscan.com/tokenapprovalchecker?search=YourWalletAddress). You'll see that the address used is Permit 2 which is different than the Router 2 address that hummingbot is configured to use.


**Release version**
// Include your bot's version number (Can be found at the upper left corner of your CLI).
Experienced this will all versions of hummingbot up to Version: 1.16.0 


**Optional: your discord username:**
cryptojorge

title: Add `hedged-lp` strategy

* Hummingbot's main use is for liquidity provision

* The strategy will hedge that position's risk on a CLOB perpetual and/or spot exchange using PositionExecutor

* Many basic functions like approving tokens and seeing transaction status, are not intuitive

* Fix the `amm-arb` strategy so that users can use it on Uniswap V2 and similar DEXs

title: Gate.io perpetual - Available balance become inconsistent with the exchange after orders refreshed
body:
**Describe the bug**
Available balance become inconsistent after bot placing first 2 pair of orders, 
after delay (about a ~1 minute) bot check the correct balance 
after first order_refresh time: available balance remain inconsistent
could lead to insufficient balance for orders


**Steps To Reproduce**

2. Create perpetualMM startegy using gate.io perpetual and order refresh time 120
3. start the strategy
4. check status --live
5. wait for order refresh time pass


Actual:
review Available balance become inconsistent with the exchange after orders refreshed


Loom video:
https://www.loom.com/share/3bad2a3ed1f94983a89090d7f516d331
Here I have 44usdt and one OPEN position for ~15usdt 
Bot place 2 orders with ~12usdt each
available balance `should be around 5 usdt after placing 2 orders`
however bot showed `17usdt` as available balance
after ~1 minute bot showed corrent balance available (5usdt)
then bot cancelled old orders to OPEN and creating new orders to OPEN
before order refresh time ends bot reported:  

```
INFO - Insufficient balance: BUY order (price: 29242.2, size: 0.0004) is omitted.

2023-04-19 11:40:53,001 - 2089747 - hummingbot.strategy.perpetual_market_making.perpetual_market_making - WARNING - You are also at a possible risk of being liquidated if there happens to be an open loss.
```

Then `Client doesn't see available balance` is 29 usdt (my guess it use 17 usdt as available) and `place only OPEN order to BUY`
