title: Hummingbot Dashboards
body:
## Why

* Currently, the only way to analyze the performance of the bot is by running the `history` command
* A graphical controller interface  (GUI) is the one of the most frequent requests from the community


## What

* We will create a Performance dashboard in https://github.com/hummingbot/streamlit-apps that will show information related to the return of a strategy
* The dashboard will support multiple running bots
* Users will be able to deploy bots and the dashboard in a single deployment using Docker Compose
* We envision different dashboards for types of strategies, for example, for the directional strategy will show information related to the signals executed by the bot like: win/lose ratio, max drawdown, pnl, etc.
* The first pages are going to be provided by the Foundation and the custom pages for strategies are going to be developed by the community.

title: Add candles feed source for Silver exchanges
body:
## Why

* The new Candles Feed component that was added to Binance and Binance Perpetual connectors have been popular with users who want to incorporate custom indicators into their strategies.
* Adding more data sources allows users to identify price price discrepancies across exchanges and add more options for candles feeds

## What

If the exchanges below support a k-lines data feed, we will create bounties to incentivize community developers to add similar data feeds for the following Epoch 4 Silver exchanges:

* Kucoin
* Kucoin Perpetual
* Gate.io
* Gate.io Perpetual
* AscendEx
* dYdX Perpetual

title: Create Hummingbot Library
body:
## Why

- The objective is to launch the Hummingbot library, allowing different users to install the project by doing: pip install hummingbot
- One source of income of the foundation is the fee share agreement with the exchanges. If now the connectors can be imported and used in other projects, the fee share should rise.

## What

- When you clone the repository now, you have all the CEX connectors and also the gateway in the same repository. If you want to run a lightweight version you have to know which are the things that you can delete without breaking the project. 
- With this change, you will be able to just install what you need, for example:
  - pip install hummingbot[slim]
  - pip install hummingbot[all]

title: Smart component - Grid executor for spot
body:
## Why

* [Smart Components](https://docs.hummingbot.org/scripts/smart-components/) are a new paradigm that let users create a self-executing, encapsulated piece of logic. They open a lot of possibilities in order to create more complex strategies.
* The first Smart Component (`PositionExecutor`) is designed for perpetual swap exchanges, but more examples of Smart Components are needed
* The grid strategy is widely used, and creating a smart component that will let you have multiple grids in the same trading pair will be something amazing for a quant that is trying to code a more complex strategy.

## What

* Create a new Smart Component that creates a grid trading bot for spot exchanges

title: Smart component - Grid executor Perpetuals
body:
## Why

* [Smart Components](https://docs.hummingbot.org/scripts/smart-components/) are a new paradigm that let users create a self-executing, encapsulated piece of logic. They open a lot of possibilities in order to create more complex strategies.
* The first Smart Component (`PositionExecutor`) is designed for perpetual swap exchanges, but more examples of Smart Components are needed
The grid strategy is widely used, and creating a smart component that will let you have multiple grids in the same trading pair will be something amazing for a quant that is trying to code a more complex strategy.

## What

* * Create a new Smart Component that creates a grid trading bot for perpetual exchanges

title: Smart component - Position Executor for Spot
body:
## Why

* [Smart Components](https://docs.hummingbot.org/scripts/smart-components/) are a new paradigm that let users create a self-executing, encapsulated piece of logic. They open a lot of possibilities in order to create more complex strategies.
* The first Smart Component (`PositionExecutor`) is designed for perpetual swap exchanges, but more examples of Smart Components are needed
## What

* Create a new Smart Component that creates and monitors a trade in a spot market
* This component will be useful to create better market-making strategies and also to allow the creation of the GridExecutor for spot.
* Expose similar inputs (take profit, stop loss, time limit)

title: Support deposit and withdrawal on Gold/Silver CEX connectors
body:
## Why

* Since Hummingbot is evolving into a general framework, it should allow users to automate more functionalities via API
* Many users have requested that Hummingbot support deposit and withdrawal capabilities, so that they can build more advanced strategies

## Why

Month 1: Hummingbot Foundation will add `deposit` and `withdrawal` API endpoints for the Gold spot CEX connector (Binance)
Month 2: Hummingbot Foundation will create bounties for community devs to add similar endpoints for the Silver spot CEX connectors

title: Support missing order types for Gold/Silver SPOT CLOB CEX connectors
body:
## Why

![Image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36869960/231305666-014bcc7f-175d-4917-b617-503ceacb12b4.png)
* Since Hummingbot is evolving into a general framework, it should allow users to access more order types via API and build strategies that that use them
* The current implementation for SPOT CEX CLOB connectors only supports LIMIT and LIMIT_MAKER with limited support for MARKET

## What
- Month 1: Review the currently supported types
- Month 2: Add support for the missing order types for Binance (Gold)
- Month 3: Create bounties to add missing order types for Silver CEX spot connectors

title: Websocket update limitation for order book Level 1

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

body:
**Description:**
The issue is when you want to place the order to the BestBid price it is outdated for 100ms and the Limit order is filled as Taker order on regular basis, the same is for BestAsk order for the Binance exchange.

That is very significant limitation for HFT strategies.

The Binance connector subsrcibed to ws order book depth stream from Binance API with the update speed 100ms and the Level 1 of order book is updated real-time with the Book Ticker ws stream. 

When you get the BestBid or BestAsk price inside the script it is outdated up to 100ms, the connector can receive it 100 times faster by subscribing to ws Book Ticker sream.

**Suggestions:**
Add the BookTicker stream to the order_boop.pyx and event or async method OnUpdateBookTickerStream() that will be available from the script.

These methods should be adjusted to get  data from Book Ticker stream real-time:
        self.bid = self.connectors[self.exchange].get_price_by_type(self.trading_pair, PriceType.BestBid)
        bid_size = self.connectors[self.exchange].get_volume_for_price(self.trading_pair, False, self.bid)
        self.ask = self.connectors[self.exchange].get_price_by_type(self.trading_pair, PriceType.BestAsk)
        ask_size = self.connectors[self.exchange].get_volume_for_price(self.trading_pair, True, self.ask)

Comparison of the update speed for ws streams: bookticker vs depth100ms (from 10 to 100 times faster approx.)
 
[bookticker_vs_depth100ms _btcusdt_ws_data.txt](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/files/10449912/bookticker_vs_depth100ms._btcusdt_ws_data.txt)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17851813/213358988-1bb07d38-05e4-4948-a939-fc33f0efbc4a.png)



**Streams description from Binance API docs:**

Real-time updated:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17851813/212754997-6eec32f5-f6ff-490c-8b65-2b159a728ef9.png)

100ms updated:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17851813/212755094-1920cd11-5e26-4e83-9dc4-91802d8af046.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17851813/212755243-f1d39a68-b9f8-45b8-b72f-f7a6fe00302f.png)

title: Quickswap - "Price query failed" if pair is on quickswap v3
body:
**Describe the bug**
Ran `amb_arb` strategy between `WETH-BOB/uniswap_polygon_mainnet` and `WETH-BOB/quickswap_polygon_mainnet` when the bot started the gateway reports about an error:
``` 
Price query failed: call revert exception [ See: https://links.ethers.org/v5-errors-CALL_EXCEPTION ] (method="getReserves()", data="0x", errorArgs=null, errorName=null, errorSignature=null, reason=null, code=CALL_EXCEPTION, version=abi/5.6.4) | Error: Price query failed: call revert exception [ See: https://links.ethers.org/v5-errors-CALL_EXCEPTION ] (method="getReserves()", data="0x", errorArgs=null, errorName=null, errorSignature=null, reason=null, code=CALL_EXCEPTION, version=abi/5.6.4)
    at /usr/src/app/dist/src/connectors/uniswap/uniswap.controllers.js:74:23
    at Generator.throw (<anonymous>)
    at rejected (/usr/src/app/dist/src/connectors/uniswap/uniswap.controllers.js:6:65)
    at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:95:5)
```
After some research I have figured out that the issue happens in the connector `quickswap` -- it works only with V2 pools whereas the pair "WETH-BOB" exists on QuickSwapV3. Upgrade of Quickswap SDK did not help since V3 it has no support of V3 either.


**Steps To Reproduce**

Here are the steps to reproduce the issue (see attachments in the section below):
1. Create and configure the gateway to communicate to uniswap and quickswap. 
2. `gateway config polygon.networks.mainnet.tokenListType URL`
3. `gateway config polygon.networks.mainnet.tokenListSource https://token-list.sushi.com/`
4. Start the gateway
5. Configure `amm_arb` strategy to monitor pairs WETH-BOB on uniswap and quickswap.
6. Wait for market readiness. 

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20793260/210070662-e4ff91d2-56aa-4204-8957-77f725b5bdb4.png)

**Release version**
1.11.0

**Attachments**
I have modified a bit the connectors for uniswap and quickswap to be more verbose so they allow to see which call of `estimateSellTrade` or `estimateBuyTrade` fails.
The attached log: [logs_gateway_app.log.2022-12-30.log](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/files/10324767/logs_gateway_app.log.2022-12-30.log)

**Optional: your discord username:**
Alexander Kolotov#0291

There are enough funds at https://etherscan.io/address/0xbca8c16af62e799d6d0f667e653efae7ef735807 **Steps To Reproduce** Here are the steps to reproduce the issue (see attachments in the section below): 1. `$ git checkout v1.11.0` 2. `$ docker build --file=Dockerfile.arm --tag=hummingbot .` 3. ``` $ docker run -it --log-opt max-size=10m --log-opt max-file=5 --network host --name hummingbot-instance \ --mount "type=bind,source=$(pwd)/hummingbot_files/hummingbot_conf,destination=/conf/" \ --mount "type=bind,source=$(pwd)/hummingbot_files/hummingbot_logs,destination=/logs/" \ --mount "type=bind,source=$(pwd)/hummingbot_files/hummingbot_data,destination=/data/" \ --mount "type=bind,source=$(pwd)/hummingbot_files/hummingbot_scripts,destination=/scripts/" \ --mount "type=bind,source=$(pwd)/hummingbot_files/hummingbot_certs,destination=/home/hummingbot/.hummingbot-gateway/certs/" \ --mount "type=bind,source=$(pwd)/hummingbot_files/gateway_conf,destination=/gateway-conf/" \ --mount "type=bind,source=/var/run/docker.sock,destination=/var/run/docker.sock" \ -e CERTS_FOLDER="$(pwd)/hummingbot_files/hummingbot_certs" \ -e GATEWAY_LOGS_FOLDER="$(pwd)/hummingbot_files/gateway_logs" \ -e GATEWAY_CONF_FOLDER="$(pwd)/hummingbot_files/gateway_conf" \ hummingbot ``` 4. Create gateway (as usual. [The result](https://share.cleanshot.com/rNwQ84Fg) is `Gateway: ONLINE`) 5. Add `uniswap` to gateway. The result: 6. Add `binance` exchange 7. Check `balance` 8. Create `amm_arb` strategy (config at the attachments) with defaults: 9. Start the strategy. Balances look good: 10. Stop the strategy in a few minutes There are a lot of errors like that (in hummingbot_files/hummingbot_logs/logs_conf_amm_arb_3.log): ``` 2022-12-29 15:52:33,403 - 1 - GatewayEVMAMM - ERROR - Error submitting approval order for USDT on uniswap-mainnet. (/usr/src/app/node_modules/@ethersproject/providers/lib/json-rpc-provider.js:703:47)\n at step (/usr/src/app/node_modules/@ethersproject/providers/lib/json-rpc-provider.js:48:23)\n at Object.throw (/usr/src/app/node_modules/@ethersproject/providers/lib/json-rpc-provider.js:29:53)\n at rejected (/usr/src/app/node_modules/@ethersproject/providers/lib/json-rpc-provider.js:21:65)\n at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:95:5)'} ``` There is a log in the gateway's log file (hummingbot_files/gateway_logs/logs_gateway_app.log.2022-12-29) that looks suspicious: ``` 2022-12-30 05:12:48 | info | Calling approve method called for spender 0x68b3465833fb72A70ecDF485E0e4C7bD8665Fc45 requesting allowance 115792089237316195423570985008687907853269984665640564039457584007913129639935 from owner 0xBCA8C16af62E799D6d0F667e653Efae7Ef735807. | undefined ``` Looks like we call approve for amount equals `115792089237316195423570985008687907853269984665640564039457584007913129639935` I've try to patch `/evm/approve` call to provide smaller amount of USDT/WETH, but it didn't help. title: Improve Remote VSCode's Dev Experience in Hummingbot Container

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

body:
**Feature Suggestion**
As my dev habit, I am used to running hummingbot in Docker container and then I remote my VSCode to the container. The overall experience is good, except that its integrated terminal doesn't pick up both `conda` and Conda version of Python interpreter, despite I edited `/home/hummingbot/.bashrc` inside the container.

Later I found that `/root/.bashrc` is the right script that I should edit because the integrated terminal is actually NOT reading `/home/hummingbot/.bashrc`.

I found the existence of `/home/hummingbot/.bashrc` a bit confusing because it contains valid preset-commands but the bash shell is actually reading `/root/.bashrc`. Should we move those commands to `/root/.bashrc` instead? Alternative is to append `source /home/humminbot/.bashrc` on `/root/.bashrc`. What do you think?

PS: If there is a consensus on the solution, I could help raise a PR on that.

My Machine: M1 Mac Pro 2021
Image Version: version-1.11.0-arm_beta

**Impact**
I believe its a simple change but will make the dev experience of remote VSCode into the container more pleasant and convenient. Because developer doesn't have to manually source `/home/hummingbot/.bashrc` whenever they open a new integrated terminal.

**Additional context**
Here I show you how the VSCode's integrated could pick up both conda and conda's Python by the solution I suggested (i.e. appending a line (`source /home/hummingbot/.bashrc` on `~/.bashrc`)



https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21143399/209386875-c68ccae4-3f9b-4433-8789-2d06a4af4147.mov

title: Unhandled error in background task  not reset `self._in_start_check` to False
body:
**Describe the bug**
I'm writing some Scripts in hummingbot.  Occasionally encountered some `async_utils - Unhandled error in background task xxxx` while starting the script. 

Once this happened, I have to fix the error of course. but after I fixed it, trying to start the script it again.  It says that this bot is already running.  **I've no choice but to exit the bot and reenter the docker with provided `start.sh`.** 

It's not convenient at all.   After some digging.  I found the code...

```python
# hummingbot/client/command/start_command.py:118
        try:
            self._initialize_strategy(self.strategy_name)
        except NotImplementedError:
            self._in_start_check = False   # <--- only `NotImplementedError will reset to False. 
            self.strategy_name = None
            self.strategy_file_name = None
            self.notify("Invalid strategy. Start aborted.")
            raise
```

Is it appropriate to capture `All Exceptions`? 

**Steps To Reproduce**

write any script with syntax error will reproduce it.


**Release version**
1.10.0

title: BitgetPerpetualDerivative._trading_pair_position_mode_set uses a wrong endpoint.

Cf) https://bitgetlimited.github.io/apidoc/en/mix/#change-hold-mode
https://bitgetlimited.github.io/apidoc/en/mix/#change-margin-mode

I'm not used to using pulling requesting codes so I just let know the part that should be fixed.

title: Bybit spot wrong order amount when market buying
body:
Bybit spot uses the same order amount for both sides of the trading pair.

I.E. if order_amount is set to 100, it will attempt to sell 100 tokens for USDT but also tries to buy $100 worth of tokens instead of just buying 100 tokens.

It happens when using amm_arb strategy with dex(quickswap) as a second connector and attempting to sell on Bybit spot.


release version 1.9.0 as well as dev-1.10.0


![Screenshot 2022-11-05 at 12 25 56 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/108356919/200080309-de4bbbf7-f51d-47ff-b031-60b21b384ccb.png)
[logs_conf_amm_arb.log](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/files/9942169/logs_conf_amm_arb.log)

title: Bitmart fixed_grid created limit orders but removed all after 10 minutes.
body:
**Describe the bug**
// A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
When starting fixed_grid on BitMart, the robot created order as per the config. So far so good. But after 10 minutes, warning sign (client_order_tracker failed) appeared. Then all limit orders being removed. This remained until the next cycle (order refresh time = 1800 secs). Then the bugs repeat as per the initial cycle above.

Summary:
Start - all running good as per config.
10 min - client_order_tracker failed. All orders removed.

30 min - New cycle started (order_refresh_time=1800)
40 min - client_order_tracker failed. All orders removed. 

And so on.

**Steps To Reproduce**
// A concise description of the **steps to reproduce the buggy behavior**:

Here are the steps to reproduce the issue (see attachments in the section below):
1. Set up your configuration file with these parameters (Figure 01)
   -any grid level is ok. I have tested with 50 and 100 grids, still the same result.
   -I set the API rate limit to 50%, which I think is not related to the bug
   - I am using max order = 999999999999999 from the BitMart quickfix for other bug. Again, I dont think it linked to this bug.
2. Start the robot ("start").

**Screenshots**
// If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
Figure 01. Config
![01  Config](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28507950/197395797-e976ad05-b994-4eb4-848b-a01ec440447e.jpg)

title: Change Log and config file location for Docker install to hummingbot_files

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

labels.name: gateway
labels.description: Related to Gateway module

body:
**Feature Suggestion**

Currently the log and config file location for the docker install of gateway sits in the `.hummingbot-gateway/`. To make all the files from the docker install in a central location, We suggest changing the log and config location for Docker install to hummingbot_files.

**Impact**
- This serves to centralize the location for all the files from the docker install. 
- This will change the behavior, but it gives a better user experience when it comes to accessing the logs and config files.  

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

title: AvellanedaMarketMakingStrategy simga/vol parameter is different with paper/blog
body:
in [code](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/blob/f1115b480b306ab62adc39815f89f4c0577d4857/hummingbot/strategy/avellaneda_market_making/avellaneda_market_making.pyx) line 755
```python
            self._reservation_price = price - (q * self.gamma * vol * time_left_fraction)

            self._optimal_spread = self.gamma * vol * time_left_fraction
            self._optimal_spread += 2 * Decimal(1 + self.gamma / self._kappa).ln() / self.gamma

            min_spread = price / 100 * Decimal(str(self._config_map.min_spread))

```
vol is calculate by [code](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/blob/f1115b480b306ab62adc39815f89f4c0577d4857/hummingbot/strategy/__utils__/trailing_indicators/instant_volatility.py) line 14
```python
        vol = np.sqrt(np.sum(np.square(np.diff(np_sampling_buffer))) / np_sampling_buffer.size)
```

But as [blog](https://hummingbot.io/zh/blog/2021-04-avellaneda-tech-deepdown) 
![formula](https://images.ctfassets.net/h07e7qaokuyy/7KCO5yhYKI9qc6n6h0XPTW/e0281e206e6c1024b47eed48ea45d742/reservation_price.png?w=394&h=106&q=100&fm=webp)

so vol formula should use this?

```python
        vol = np.sum(np.square(np.diff(np_sampling_buffer))) / np_sampling_buffer.size
```

title: Bybit_Perpetual - Spot_perpetual_arbitrage Inverse markets Trading not possible
body:
**Describe the bug**
Upon testing `Spot_perpetual_arbitrage` with `Bybit_perpetual` as the derivative using `inverse` markets (XXX/USD) and starting the strategy. The bot displays it `Cannot arbitrage, bybit_perpetual USD balance (0) is 0.` and that `Trading not possible.`  It looks like Spot_Perp_Arbitrage checks if it can place an order, it checks the perp connector for balance in the quote token. It should check against the collateral token instead.


**Steps To Reproduce**
Here are the steps to reproduce the issue (see attachments in the section below):
1. Create spot_perptual_arbitrage strategy
2. Any spot and have bybit_perpetual as derivative
3. Set derivative inverse markets as XXX/USD
4. Set perpetual leverage to 100x
5. Start strategy and check status
6. Observe log pane

body:

1. clone and install feature branch
2. create a pureMM strategy using HitBTC as connector
3. use tight spread to get a partial fills

title: Add `chain` level in connector `contractAddresses` lookup

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

labels.name: gateway
labels.description: Related to Gateway module

body:
**Feature Suggestion**

Currently `contractAddresses` in each DEX connector template only supports various networks - for example, see https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/blob/master/gateway/src/templates/uniswap.yml. Since Uniswap and other DEXs live on different networks on different chains, it would be better to add a `chain` level so that the config template can define addresses for each network on different chains with the format:

```
contractAddresses:
  ethereum:
    mainnet:
    kovan:
  polygon:
    mainnet:
    mumbai:
```

The controller file for each DEX must be modified to handle this change.

**Impact**

Prevents collisions in network name. Currently, the only reason that Uniswap works is that the `mainnet` address is identical for their Polygon and Ethereum deployments.


**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

title: HB Docker Container writes local files as user 8211 causing SIGKILL
body:
**Describe the bug**
Having a ton of problems with Hummingbot Docker in reading and writing to the local files created in the folder hummingbot_files. After some research I discovered that the reason this is happening is that the user and group keep getting changed to 8211 instead of the user:group of the user running the container. 
Researching this a bit further shows that someone changed the docker container user to the TCP port of Hummingbot instead of the hummingbot or local user. (please see the screenshot)

This has some very unintended consequences with the bot SIGKilling itself because it can't write to the local file-system.

**Steps To Reproduce**
Create a Hummingbot using the ./create.sh script
Start hummingbot using the ./start.sh script
observe the local filesystem 
ls -la ~/hummingbot_files
observe that the user:group is set to 8211:8211
Configure the bot and let it run
Bot starts to throw errors and eventually SIGKILL's itself




Here are the steps to reproduce the issue (see attachments in the section below):
./create.sh
./start.sh
observe the filesystem

start htop to see that the python command is even sending set user 8211

**Screenshots**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10052587/176942436-ff5bcfd8-f10c-4aec-9080-c86bee090bc5.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10052587/176942899-41ec7ea0-1d6b-41af-ae37-b1cbeef69c42.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10052587/176943529-470ea025-6825-4a9c-bf69-1c6083200f65.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10052587/176941517-ece8b290-2f09-424e-9c03-fa1c79823f79.png)



**Release version**
1.4.0

**Attachments**
Log file is unnecessary as this is clearly a code refactoring issue as per the last screenshot. Someone/something did a find and replace with 8211 it looks like between the Docker container files and the TCP port files.


**Optional: your discord username:**
Bhagavate bilala#6332

title: **Hold and Current Portfolio Values Inaccurate in History, in Paper Trading, ? Calculating Hold for the Current, instead of Opposite Way**
body: **Hold and Current Portfolio Values Inaccurate in History, in Paper Trading* by up to 200%* Currently i see when running `binance_papertrade` the Hold Portfolio Value and the Current Portfolio Value both do not seem to be accurate at all, for example issues i see: - _Current Portfolio Value_ in `History` does NOT match the total of the Assets Value in `Status`. - _Hold Portfolio Value increased_, despite the fact the underlying asset losing, in fact the coin having lost 30% in its value/price. - _Current Portfolio Value not changing at all_, staying the same number at all times, equal to the initial `paper_balance`. - Or when i calculate what the value should be, its no where near. 1. **Example one:** 1)Paper trade last night on LUNA-BUSD on` pure_market_making` strategy : **Started with all these:** - `Balance Paper LUNA 1000000`,` Balance Paper BUSD 200` - $LUNA price was 0.00023086 at time of start - Thus Initial Portfolio Value = $430.86 BUSD **Now (earlier), as shown in attachments :** Price of LUNA = 0.0001804 (lose of around 30% from start) `History` - _Hold Portfolio Value_ = **421.9 BUSD** - _Current Portfolio Value_ = **379.6 BUSD** - _Fees Paid_ = 26.46 BUSD `Status` - Assets LUNA = 644999.9836, BUSD = 278.7784 BUSD - _Thus total value of assets / current portfolio here_ = **395.17 BUSD** Above _Hold Portfolio Value_ calculated with current price of LUNA based on initial starting balances of 1000000 LUNA and 200 BUSD, (1000000 x 0.0001804) + 200BUSD = **380.40 BUSD** As you can easily see above, none of these seem to match. **2. Example 2: same bot as above.** Same bot as above, but just taken a History about 30min later, when the price of LUNA has fallen more. So now you see that the price of **LUNA has fallen further** to 0.00017914, yet the **Hold Portfolio Value is now HIGHER** at 457 BUSD. **3. Example 3 different bot: ** This is a different bot / different instance compared to the other ones, this is running on a different strategy type too, using the `avellanda_market_marking` strategy: **Start** - I set the `Balance Paper BUSD 200`, and 0 for the LUNA here, initially. - So the initial Portfolio Value = 200BUSD - Initially was no $Luna so shouldn't matter to Hold Portfolio Value ? as should always just be 200BUSD for holding value ? However for sake of working out the problem, the price of LUNA at starting the bot was = 0.0002423. **NOW** - Hold Portfolio Value = 345 BUSD - Current Portfolio Value = 200 BUSD The price of LUNA now is 0.00017 (a big lose from the initial value too), So the **asset value of LUNA has gone down but yet the Hold portfolio value has gone up by 145BUSD** from it's starting, the hold value of the initial 200BUSD, 0 LUNA however shouldnt of changed at all. And the **Current portfolio value never changes, its always at 200BUSD every time i've checked** in the `History`. ? In the 3rd example it looks like maybe the **`Current Portfolio Value` is incorrectly showing the `Hold Portfolio Value `** ? _Originally posted by @physioshane in https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/issues/3093#issuecomment-1128501392_

title: Avellenada reservation price is frequently slow to update
body:
**Describe the bug**
Avellenada bot often falls into a state where it fails to update the Reservation Price on a highly liquid kucoin pair. This results in a series of rapid, sequential buys or sells all within a tight price range when the midprice moves away from the Reservation Price. 

Restarting the bot refreshes the reservation price. 

This may be related to (or perhaps identical) to the behavior where it frequently takes 5-10 minutes for the bot to begin trading after it's finished filling its buffers.

**Steps To Reproduce**
Trade a liquid pair, such as LUNA-USDT on kucoin and monitor Reservation price using "status --live". After some period of time, the reservation price will stop being recalculated.

The bug is somewhat intermittent (but occurs several times a day). 

* t3.micro instance (EC2) - upgraded because CPU was constantly at 100%. This is still the case.
* Docker


**Screenshots**

Example: currently sitting at 100% inventory. The MidPrice has dropped steadily yet the Reservation Price is still unchanged and sitting well above. This causes buy orders to be placed right at the spread.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36650369/157322037-e5c9f123-d92d-47ce-a1fe-8ace67fb95e5.png)


**Release version**
* Development branch - dev-1.0.0

**Attachments**
[logs_conf_avellaneda_market_making_1.log](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/files/8209513/logs_conf_avellaneda_market_making_1.log)
[conf_avellaneda_market_making_1.zip](https://github.com/hummingbot/hummingbot/files/8209526/conf_avellaneda_market_making_1.zip)

Discord: optiontrader1138

title: Update price_band and price_ceiling params

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

body:
**Why**
The `price_band` and `price_ceiling` params in PMM are useful for market making in highly volatile markets. However, since it requires users to set actual prices, it's unwieldy to use. Also, the bot doesn't update the bands automatically.

Also, there's no way to update these bands once they are set.

Based on user feedback, the following changes would improve their user experience with price bands.

**What**
Change `price_floor` to `price_floor_pct` and `price_ceiling` to `price_ceiling_pct` so that users enter % to the current price rather than fixed prices.

`price_ceiling_pct` prompt text: "Enter a percentage to the current price that sets the price ceiling. Above this price, only sell orders will be placed"

`price_floor_pct` prompt text: "Enter a percentage to the current price that sets the price floor. Below this price, only buy orders will be placed"

Add a parameter called `price_band_refresh_time`. After this amount of time (in seconds), the price bands are reset based on the current price. The default value for this param should be 86400 (1 day).

title: Create method to create multiple orders and cancel multiple orders in a single api call.

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

body:
**Feature Suggestion**
// A succinct description of **how you want to achieve the desired behavior**.
// If you have looked at the code and know exactly what code changes are needed then please _consider submitting a pull request_ instead.
Create a method to create multiple orders and cancel multiple orders in a single API call.

**Impact**
// A succinct description of **why you want the _desired behavior_** specified above.
Many exchanges have some API rate limits. For example, kucoin only has a limit of 45 calls per 3s. This means you can only have 15 calls /s and if you use a total order level of 4 you would already exceed the order limits. ((4on buys + 4 on sells) * (1-time cancellation + 1-time creation) = 16 calls/s, so most of the time you would have to use much more keys which is inconvenient. and Kucoin only has a 10 Key limit, so we cannot run on a lot of exchange if we want to use order levels.

By allowing us to make multiple creation/cancellation of orders in a single API, we can reduce the number of calls significantly for many strategies.

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.
Most if not all exchanges support some sort of bulk orders or cancel orders which I think is also already present in some of the connector codes.

Please do inform me if I somehow missed out on the method for calling/canceling multiple orders directly.

So far most of the strategies I find loop through all the orders and cancel/create them one by one.
And I do know there is an async def cancel_all function which probably can add an additional method to make it a sync function for easier use?

https://docs.kucoin.com/#place-bulk-orders

title: Add distance option between placed orders for MM strategies

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

body:
For market making strategies add minimum distance option between placed orders.

**Current behavior:** 
When the buy_1 order is filled the corresponding hanging sell_1 order is placed,
on next order refresh time if the price is not changed or changed insignificantly, buy_2 order is placed almost at the same price of buy_1 and filled,  corresponding hanging sell_2 order is placed at the same price of sell_1 order. And so on, thus, we are increasing inventory risk in same spread range and not taking the spread as hanging sell orders are not filled, that is called Adverse Selection Bias for Bid/Ask inequal execution.

![screen1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17851813/149894485-8bba9c9e-f77c-4aa1-889e-70c48616e5df.png)


**Suggested behavior:** 
When the buy_1 order is filled the corresponding hanging sell_1 order is placed,
on next order refresh time:

1. If the hanging sell_1 order is filled, the spead is taken, placing buy_2 and sell_2 orders for next time cyrcle,
    Else, hanging sell_1 order is not filled or partially filled.
2. If Current last price <= (buy_1 order filled price - Bid spead) and Current last price <=  (hanging sell_1 order price - Ask spread)
    (checking both the bid and ask distances as they can be different if calculated using Aroon indicator for example)
     Than the price is lower from previous order's range and placing buy_2 and sell_2 orders for next time cyrcle.
     Else, do nothing and waiting for next time cyrlce check.

This feature will reduce strategy inventory risk and eleminate Adverse Selection Bias when price spread is in range.

title: Arbitrage strategy amount is incorrect when using oracle rates
body:
**Describe the bug**
When using an arbitrage strategy between two markets with different quote currencies, when using the oracle, the order amount will be calculated incorrectly. I guess this scenario is not handled by the  `c_find_best_profitable_amount` because based on my debugging the output of this method is wrong too.

**Steps To Reproduce**

Here are the steps to reproduce the issue (see attachments in the section below):
1. Configure the bot with an arbitrage strategy. Here is a sample:
```
#####################################
###   Arbitrage strategy config   ###
#####################################

template_version: 5
strategy: arbitrage

# The following configuations are only required for the
# arbitrage strategy

# Exchange and token parameters
primary_market: ${EXCHANGE}
secondary_market: ${SECONDARY_EXCHNGE}
primary_market_trading_pair: ${MARKET}
secondary_market_trading_pair: ${SECONDARY_MARKET}

# Minimum profitability target required to place an order
# Expressed in percentage value, e.g. 1 = 1% target profit
min_profitability: ${PROFIT}

# Whether to use rate oracle on unmatched trading pairs
# Set this to either True or False
use_oracle_conversion_rate: True

secondary_to_primary_base_conversion_rate:
secondary_to_primary_quote_conversion_rate:

# For more detailed information, see:
# https://docs.hummingbot.io/strategies/arbitrage/#configuration-parameters
```
Use two markets with two different quotes in primary and secondary markets. (Oracle must be able to convert the quotes) For example `BTC_USDT` and `BTC_EUR` 
2. Start the bot. As soon as the bot tries to place an order, the values will be calculated incorrectly.

title: Add retry logic to Gateway connectors

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

labels.name: gateway
labels.description: Related to Gateway module

body:
**Feature Suggestion**
There's a need to have a retry logic for Gateway connectors due to the nature of blockchain transactions which take varying time to get confirmed. Strategies would also perform better when orders to gateway connectors are confirmed asap.

**Impact**
`_update_order_status` function in gateway base connector in the client should be updated to enable a retry when none of the transactions associated with an order id has been confirmed and last retry transaction is older than 120 seconds.

**Notes**
- A list of all transactions associated with an order should be maintained in the inflight tracker of each order. That way it'll be possible to know which transaction was confirmed when others are dropped.
- No retry should be attempted when any of the transactions associated with an order id fail. Such order should be reported as failed.
- Only the nonce should be sent in addition to the usual trade parameters when attempting retry. Gateway should be left to  determine the new fee to use.

## DoD
- HB Client able to trigger a retry of a particular TX to the Gateway (passing the nonce).

title: Create option to ONLY keep hanging orders of the levels that were filled when quoting multiple levels

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

labels.name: strategy
labels.description: Strategies ideas

body:
**Feature Suggestion**
Create a configuration option to ONLY keep hanging orders of the levels that were filled when quoting multiple levels.

Consider the example where the bot is quoting 2 price levels on each side of the book, and that we have hanging orders enabled. In the current set up, if one level on one side of the book is filled, then the two levels on the other side will remain hanging. This may result in an imbalanced inventory over time especially with higher number of order levels.

The new feature for example can be called `keep_all_hanging_order_levels`. If this is set to `True` then the current behaviour applies, where all orders on the opposite side of the filled order will remain hanging. If it is set to `False`, then only the orders that are mirror opposite of the one(s) that are filled will remain hanging. In the example above, only one price level will remain hanging on the other side of the book.

**Impact**
This feature will allow for a more inventory balanced trading strategy especially when using many levels in the book.

title: XEMM Spot to futures hedging - to improve risk management options and capital efficiency

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

labels.name: strategy
labels.description: Strategies ideas

body:
THIS ISSUE IS CREATED TO PARTICIPATE IN THE COMMUNITY VOTING FOR THE STRATEGY IMPROVEMENTS✅

**Feature Suggestion**
At the moment cross-exchange market making is only possible for Spot to Spot market. To improve **capital efficiency**✅ **increase risk management**✅, increase the use of the **DYDX exchange**✅and have a better **alternative to the spot-perp arbitrage**✅strategy, I propose to make **hedging on a perpetual market**, possible for the cross-exchange-market making strategy. 

**Impact**
// A succinct description of **why you want the _desired behavior_** specified above.

By **allowing hedging on a perpetual exchange** your funds are automatically hedged✅ resulting in a delta neutral strategy and improvement of risk management options. If your buy maker order gets filled, you automatically hedge it with a taker sell order on the perpetual exchange, resulting in a position that is effectively zero of coin x (as you go long and short at the same time). 

This **increases capital efficiency** as you do not need to have x number of tokens on exchange 1 and x amount of tokens on exchange 2 and x amount of tokens on your hedging exchange✅ Cross-collateral is possible and you can use leverage to hedge the position. If you want to hedge your positions you don't need extra funds to hedge on the perpetual exchange. 

This strategy also allows for a **better alternative than the spot-perp arbitrage strategy**.✅As with that strategy you basically exploit the difference between two taker prices instead of a maker and a taker (which results in more opportunities and higher profit potential.

title: XEMM Performance Improvements - Manage Slippage & Increase Profitability

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

labels.name: strategy
labels.description: Strategies ideas

body:
THIS ISSUE IS CREATED TO PARTICIPATE IN THE COMMUNITY VOTING FOR THE STRATEGY IMPROVEMENTS

**Feature Suggestion**

Running the cross-exchange market making strategy on all mining campaigns results in a decent amount of slippage (when using the new slippage buffer function) for most of the campaigns ❌. Which negatively affects the profitability of the trading❌. This happens because the taker exchange has not enough liquidity to execute the large taker order without slippage. Liquidity mining could still be profitable, but as a trader, you would like to manage the risks of slippage so you are better able to manage the profitability of the bot. 

**In order to do so, I propose two new features.** 
✅ Levels
✅ Taker-top-depth tolerance. 

**Order-levels:**
Set multiple orders at an increased min-profitability level (see Pure Market Making Docs for explanation). 

When trading larger order sizes for a campaign, you do not want to set all your volume at one level. If your order gets taken, you need to hedge all that volume on the taker exchange, resulting in slippage and a higher chance of the trade being unprofitable. 
When orders are placed deeper in the order book, the min-profitability increases, if the order gets taken, there is more room for slippage before the trade is unprofitable ✅.

**Taker Top-Depth-Tolerance**
In the current situation, the bot uses, simply said, the best bid or ask available to fully fill your hedging taker order (VWAP). A lot of times, the price has already moved, these orders are not in the order book anymore, resulting in slippage and a potential loss ❌. Adding a taker-top-depth-tolerance feature affects the price at which the min profitability target is calculated. For example, setting this price at 2 times your order volume and your maker order gets filled, there should be more liquidity on the taker exchange to fill your taker order, resulting in less slippage and potentially higher profitability than initially expected.✅

These features are designed to better manage your slippage and profitability.✅

**Impact**
// A succinct description of **why you want the _desired behaviour_** specified above.

The desired behaviour will allow me to better manage the slippage that occurs on most smaller cap coin's liquidity mining campaigns and thereby improve the profitability of the bot.

title: Replace aiohttp and signalr_aio library with WebAssistant library - Bittrex

labels.name: refactor
labels.description: Rewrite / restructure source code without affecting its behavior

body:
See epic https://github.com/CoinAlpha/hummingbot/issues/3941 for the rationale of this task.

## Details
- The REST part of the connector, using `aiohttp`, is straight-forward
- The WS part, using `signalr_aio`, can be tackled by
    - Writing a child class of `ConnectionsFactory` that will deliver the existing `RESTConnection` and a new `WSConnection` alternative that will use `signalr_aio` instead of `aiohttp`.
- Allowing `WebAssistantsFactory` to receive a `ConnectionsFactory` injection (an `__init__` parameter) and injecting the new connections factory at the composition site.
- Base on a quick scan, the data sources classes have some opportunities to use the pre- and post-processors
    - E.g. `_transform_raw_message` is a great candidate for a post-processor

## Definition of Done
* [ ] Replace the use of `aiohttp` and `signalr_aio` libraries with `WebAssitant` in `Hitbtc` connector
* [ ] Connector should be working without issues after the change


┆Issue is synchronized with this [Clickup task](https://app.clickup.com/t/1pd0g0r) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io)

title: Paper trading Limit Orders fix

labels.name: new feature
labels.description: New features, commands, global configuration

body:
# Why
The paper trading exchange currently always assumes that limit orders were filled completely and at the exact price of the limit order.

The price assumption has been acceptable when market orders were used by strategies. Now that we use limit orders that cross the order book price to immediately close positions while controlling the risk, the order book should be considered as well.

The quantity assumption was never accurate — partial fills can happen in either case.

# What
Adapt `PaperTradeExchange`'s `c_process_limit_bid_order` method to behave like `c_execute_buy/sell`, where the `OrderBook.simulate_buy/sell` methods are used to determine how much of the order was filled and at what price.

# Definition of Done
- [ ] Paper trade limit orders that act as takers are filled at the order book price.
- [ ] Paper trade limit orders support partial fills.

# Note
Because paper trading does not affect the order book, partial fills should remove the entire order.

Example:
- Order book has an ask for 5 COINX
- We try to sell 10 COINX at a lower price
- We have a partial fill of 5 COINX, but the ask on the order book is not removed
- The remaining 5 COINX cannot remain as an active order as the subsequent tick will simulate filling them again with the same ask order that is still on the order book

title: Perpetual MM - Improve `status` command output

labels.name: estimate
labels.description: Stories to be estimated

body:
## Why

Task resulting from the research done in this story https://github.com/CoinAlpha/hummingbot/issues/4504 to display important information in `status` command output when using Perpetual Market Making strategy.

## What

Improve `status` command output in client.

## Definition of Done

The following information are shown in `status` command:

- [ ] **Open Orders**
It must show what are the current open orders, with their respective prices, and the spread between them.

- [ ] **Open Positions**
When an *Open Order* is filled, the information related to it's current state would be show here.
The following information must be added to each of the open positions:

  - `SHORT` and `LONG` tags, to identify what is the position direction
  - The price the position was opened/filled
  - Position profit/loss, in relative value (%) to the current market price
  - `TP` and `SL` prices, in absolute values
  - Liquidation Price of the position
  - Position Leverage

- [ ] **Closed Positions**
This section shows a resume of the positions that have been closed since `start` was executed.
We must have a separation between `SHORT` and `LONG` closed orders, and for each type, show the value of `Average Open` and `Average Close` prices (Refer to dYdX Positions information).
![Captura de tela 2021-11-11 16.26.49.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5f64254ca13ff3717cc3a0c5/f27b3245-733a-4b6a-ab21-d8175aa63bb0)
This allows a quick visualization if the current bot run is profitable or not.

- [ ] **Account Information**
It must show information relative to the account situation:
  - Start balance - Shows what was the total balance the moment `start` was executed
  - Current Balance - Shows what is the current account value, considering 
  - Account Profit/Loss - Both in absolute value and relative (%) to the `start` margin balance
  - Estimated Capital At Risk - The value of the total loss relative (%) to the account balance if the Stop Loss is triggered, when there is an open position.

title: Spot perp future arbitrage: Add some detail of other side of arbitrage in status, close/reverse positions when stopping/closing bot

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

labels.name: strategy
labels.description: Strategies ideas

body:
**Feature Suggestion**
// It would be great to see some detail in the status screen for the opposite side of an arbitrage, amount, value, etc.

**Impact**
// This will give better visibility of 'pending' orders, even if they have yet to be placed. Functionality to reverse the arbitrage when closing the bot is also needed.

**Additional context**
example: Kucoin spot market and binance perp futures market
Currently when an arbitrage is opened, the long/short position in the futures market is displayed in the status screen but no detail of the opposing trade taken in the spot market. When the bot is stopped and exited, neither the futures or the spot positions are closed/reversed, leaving the assets unbalanced from where they were initially allocated. 
- Currently this needs to be manually manipulated after stopping a bot while an arbitrage is in process.

level two: open at 1% and close at -0.1%

etc etc

title: Update Developer Documentation for Spot Connectors
body:
## Why
The rationale behind this user story.
Current developer docs are outdated and still suggest developers to use crypto.com connector. Also the developer documentation does not explicitly suggest developers to implement a Python-only connector


## What
Define or outline the task(s) that needs to be done.
- [ ] Update all diagrams. Shared drawio document [here](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1cS1BU4Q8-r1jxJ7POD9YBCJ3Y5S8hSOX/view?usp=sharing). All diagrams should be in `.svg`
- [ ] Update reference connector to `Ndax`
- [ ] Update necessary functions for various components
- [ ] Include Documentation on how to integrate `AsyncThrottler` into connector
- [ ] Explicitly mention about the usage of ~`aiohttp` websockets~ WebAssistantsFactory
- [ ] Explicitly mention about using ~`_shared_client`~ `_api_factory` across `Exchange`, `APIOrderBookDataSource` and `UserStreamDataSource`
- [ ] Explicitly mention about sharing a single websocket connection for order book depth and order book trades channels
- [ ] Explicitly mention the need to use the throttler also for websocket request for those exchanges limiting the number of requests
- [ ] Include `*WebAdapters` as a suggestion when implementing websocket connections throughout the connector.
- [ ] Explicitly mention that `_process_order_message()` should only update order status, while `_process_trade_message()` should update the `InFlightOrder` attributes(i.e. `executed_amount_base`) and trigger the `OrderFilledEvent` if necessary
## Definition of Done
Condition(s) or requirement(s) to be satisfied to mark this story as completed.
- Developer Documentation to reflect all the aforementioned changes.

title: New lite argument on start command
body:
## Why
To start lite strategies without having to import or create strategy configuration.


## What
* Add a new `--lite` argument option on `start` command, the value for this argument is a lite strategy file name.
* Display all lite strategy file names from `lite_strategies` folder as auto-complete dropdown menu on `start --lite` 
* Once issued, the command loads up the strategy class dynamically, initialises connectors (based on `markets` class member), and start the strategy.
         
 ## Definition of Done
* A new argument added, a list of strategy file names auto completed on start command

## Note
* Since the strategy is dynamically loaded, the strategy can be updated, stopped and started without having to exit the bot.

title: New lite strategy base class
body:
## Why
To serve as a new base class for lite strategies. The base class simplifies strategy creation and automates processes needed to be done by every new strategy, e.g. checking market connectors are ready, so that its sub classes don't have to.


## What
**New tick loop process**
The lite strategy uses its own new tick loop process, the main reason is we want the on_tick to be an `async` process. The `async` process will allow the user to use both sync and async operations.
The `on_tick` is called after the simplified strategy base class checks all connectors are ready for trading. `tick_size` is defined as a class member to specify interval tick period in millisecond (default to 1000). Note the tick_size is a period from the start of previous tick to the start of the current tick.

**Implementation:**
* `markets` class member, a dictionary of string and a set of string to define connectors and their trading pairs needed for the strategy.
* `format_status` function where current balances and active orders are listed for every connector
* `active_orders` property, returns a list of current active orders
* `buy` a wrapper to `buy_with_specific_market` 
* `sell` a wrapper to `sell_with_specific_market`  


## Definition of Done
* New base class created with unit tests provided.

title: Introduce new Lite strategies.

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

labels.name: epic
labels.description: Collection of stories that runs through different sprints

labels.name: estimate
labels.description: Stories to be estimated

body:
## Why
Currently, to create a new strategy, a user needs to understand various inner workings of Hummingbot and to maintain a minimum of 5 files. 

[strategy]_config_map.py
Details configurations needed for a strategy.

conf_[strategy]_TEMPLATE.yml
Formats a configuration file with comments and version number.

conf_[strategy].yml
A configuration file, created automatically by the 2 files above. A user can change the setting either by using config command or by updating the file manually

start.py
Initialises the strategy, connectors and market_info objects.

[strategy].py
The main strategy file which users need to care about the most.

We are asking too much of a new user here. 

## What
This epic story is to introduce new lite strategies which simplifies strategy creation while retaining most of the features of existing strategies (except the configuration). A lite strategy needs only one file, the strategy file. To accomplish this, we need the followings:

* [Lite Strategy Base Class](#4716)
* [New lite argument on start command](#4717)
* [Lite strategy examples](#4718)


## Notes
* Lite strategies have no configuration. There is no need to use `create`, `import` and `config` commands. The strategy can be run directly on `start --lite` command.
* Lite strategies live under `lite_strategies` folder
* Lite strategies are not back-testable by Hummingsim.

title: Connectors in ticker (non order book) mode.

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

labels.name: estimate
labels.description: Stories to be estimated

body:
**Feature Suggestion**
One of the most important data we can get from most exchanges API on very low rate limit cost and easy to maintain is ticker on best bid and best ask prices. On Binance, this is https://api.binance.com/api/v3/ticker/bookTicker, at AP call weight of 2 we can get best bid and ask prices for all their active markets. For many strategies, this information is enough for their trading operation. You can think of this approach as go wide (tickers) rather than go deep (order books). Order books are resource intensive to maintain, the connector performs poorer the more order books it has, max number of order books is 10 on local machine. This is not a problem for tickers since we need to maintain only the top bid and ask prices.

To get connectors to run in this mode we'll need to
* Add fetch loop for best bid and ask prices for all connectors (fetch once every tick)
* Add is_on_ticker_mode flag, passed in on connector init 
* Add is_on_order_book_mode flag, passed in on connector init. This will make maintain order book optional.
* Update `c_get_price` or `get_price` to get price either from ticker or order book 

**Impact**
This ticker information can be used for market scanning, position trading and even market making where an order book is not required.

title: Refactor Client Order ID generation to use a more unique identifier

labels.name: refactor
labels.description: Rewrite / restructure source code without affecting its behavior

body:
## Why

From investigating the Duplicate Client Order Id in AscendEx issue, #3970, it appears that the supposedly unique `client_order_id` across **all** connectors might not be unique across Hummingbot Instances.

Generally `client_order_id` are strings that are generated by the concatenation of `BROKER_ID`, order side, trading pair and timestamp. Considering that across instances, orders might be created at the exact same timestamp, it is unlikely but real possibility that there might be duplicate `client_order_id`s.

**Note:**
Strategies should now use the `creation_timestamp` property in `LimitOrder` to determine whether or not to refresh an order.

## What
This task/tasks/epic should refactor the existing logic for `client_order_id` generation to use a concatenation of `os.getpid()` with other relevant info i.e. `HBOT_BROKER_ID` and time nonce.

## **Definition of Done**
- [ ] Refactor `client_order_id` generation across all connectors.

title: Improvement to UI text styling

labels.name: estimate
labels.description: Stories to be estimated

body:
**Why**
Currently, the `FormattedTextLexer` filters and renders formatted text through the usage of a defined text-to-styling mapping. This is less than ideal considering that devs will have to define a new formatted text and its corresponding styling for this to work.

**What**
This task should make it possible for developers to define a formatted text styling and its contents similar to that of HTML. i.e. `<red>SOME TEXT</red>` This would result in `SOME TEXT` having a red background. 
Note: The output should not or introduce minimal padding to the actual formatted text.

**Definition of Done**
- Styling of text should be defined within the command itself. i.e. `connect`
- Remove need for `text_ui_style` in `style.py`

title: Allow order_amount as percentage of asset for liquidity_mining strategy

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

labels.name: strategy
labels.description: Strategies ideas

body:
**Feature Suggestion**
Rather than (or in addition to) expressing order_amount as an absolute value, permit it to be expressed as a percentage of available assets

**Impact**
Currently, with order_amount expressed as an absolute value, if a miner's total available base or quote token is _below_ that order_amount, no order can be placed, so no liquidity is provided. Further, if a miner's total available base or quote token is _above_ that order_amount, the orders placed are less than that miner could be providing. Allowing expression of order_amount as a percentage would facilitate both more liquidity for the exchange as well as higher rewards for the miner.

**Additional context**
Brief discussion on Discord here: https://discord.com/channels/530578568154054663/585321046069215251/905419296837074974

title: Update dependencies handling

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

body:
# Why
According to Martin, the way that `hummingbot` handles dependencies is outdated, and it is the reason for which it requires listing all of the dependencies for each platform in separate files. `hummingsim` and `parrot` use a different approach where they have a template dependencies file and the platform-specific list is auto-generated.

# What
We should update the `hummingbot` approach to use the same technique as the `hummingsim` package.

# Dod
* [ ] `hummingbot`'s dependencies handling is up to date and simplified to having to maintain a single file.

title: Create a component to track the price evolution
body:
## Why?
When improving investing strategies it is important for traders to have access to the historical information on price. This information, its evolution and relationship between different markets, is required to decide when to start operating and also to detect periods of time when the operation should be paused.

## What?
We need to add a new component to the client to keep track of price information. This should be a separate component to reuse it in different strategies using different connectors.

Requirements for the component:

* It has to keep track of the price and volume associated to that price in the market.
* The number of samples to be kept will be configurable, and is related to the extent of time we are keeping samples for, not the number of trades. In this first requirement the information will be kept only in memory while the component is being used. Once the max number of samples is reached, each new sample that is added will cause the deletion of the oldest sample kept.
* The component should be able to track information for different markets (token pairs) at the same time.
* The component will provide the functionality to get the aggregated price information by period of time. For example, it could be requested the historic price info by one minute, or five minutes, 1 hour, etc. The aggregation will be done by time based on clock time, and not based on time difference from the current timestamp. The price for each aggregation will be the average price based on all the samples that are part of the set.
* Even when the component can provide the information to the strategy in different ways, we want to make sure we present the possibility to retrieve the aggregated samples as an array, where index 0 will contain the most recent sample, and index N-1 the oldest example (being N the size of the array).

The intention is to have in the future different ways to feed the component. In this requirement we will start with one of the most basic ones.
A price data sampler component will also be created. This component should be connected to the **OrderBookEvent.TradeEvent** of the order book used by the strategy, and will register a new sample in the price component for each trade event propagated by the order book.
_NOTE:_ This first sampler implementation implies that the component will only be usable with connectors that provide online public trades information through their API.

## DoD
* [ ] New component to track price created
* [ ] New sampler that provides samples based on trade events created
* [ ] Component configured for all strategies at the base strategy level, with default configurations to track a small number of samples



┆Issue is synchronized with this [Clickup task](https://app.clickup.com/t/1rg7t5d) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io)

title: DODO DEX

labels.name: new connector
labels.description: New spot / DEX connector

body:
DODO is a DeFi protocol decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol and on-chain liquidity provider whose unique proactive market maker (PMM) algorithm aims to offer better liquidity and price stability than automated market makers (AMM).

The PMM pricing mechanism, which mimics human trading, utilizes oracles to gather highly accurate market prices for assets. It then provides enough liquidity close to these prices in order to stabilize the portfolios of liquidity providers (LP), lower price slippage and negate impermanent loss by allowing arbitrage trading as reward.

DODO also caters for new crypto projects with a free ICO listing through its Initial DODO Offering (IDO) which requires issuers to only deposit their own tokens.

DODO’s smart contract operates as an ERC20 token on the Ethereum network.

Source: https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/dodo/

title: Modify mid price calculation and access the spread in units of the quote currency
body:
**Script suggestion**
// A request related to hummingbot script function
// It can be a script idea that you want to see implemented or a improvement on hummingbot script feature

**Script function or improvement**
// Describe what you want the script to do or what kind of improvement you want on the script function

I need to be able to set a custom mid-price that ignores dust offers and bids and/or place some conditions on the numeric value of the spread (best ask — best bid) to determine whether the bot should place any offers

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

## There’s a somewhat illiquid pair where the bid asks are usually far apart, so the mid-price is far from the best ask and bid. Assume that the bot purchases some units of the base currency by using bid_spreads resolved from this mid-price. If after purchase, a new ask order is placed very close to the best bid, the new mid-price shifts dramatically towards the best-bid, which is very close to the purchase price
## In that case, the new ask_spread resolved from the new mid-price will give a non-desirous sale margin, which in some cases may not be enough to cover the transaction costs
To resolve this, I need to be able to set a custom mid-price that ignores dust offers and bids and/or place some conditions on the numeric value of the spread (best ask — best bid)

title: Spot-perpetual: `is_funding_payment_time` incorrect timestamp comparison
body:
**Describe the bug**
Opening a separate ticket for tracking the funding time issue: The issue has been describe in this original ticket #3679

`is_funding_payment_time` compares the timestamps incorrectly, one is UTC and the other (time.time()) is local time. Also, from Binance perpetual derivative connector, the `next_funding_utc_timestamp` is of higher resolution (off by 1,000).

Here are the steps to reproduce the issue (see attachments in the section below):

1. Create a spot-perpetual market making strategy using Binance perpetual as the perpetual connector.
1. Start the strategy and wait for a position to be opened.
1. Monitor the test bot when it is funding time.
1. Check the timestamp when the bot executes the funding payment vs the funding period in the exchange.

title: Format the interactive tables (advanced visual)
body:
## Why
Some configuration and editing parameters are very complex to be configured. There are many configurations that we have possibilities for - and reaching them forces us to consult some documentation and execute some commands in the client.

## What
The possibility of creating an interactive experience in a configuration table in real-time makes this experience very agile to apply decision-making. It helps the user, in a clear way, which can configure a table/menu of parameters related to the command.

## Definition of Done
[Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/lmkPsyJz5zAV7SHXCaFwXd/Hummingbot-Client?node-id=283%3A297)

### **UX Interactive Tables**
![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/57179e45bf93871ccd99c501/78258d9e-bd80-418a-9eca-e8a0175b63ab)

#### How to use?
![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/57179e45bf93871ccd99c501/a7ba65da-71d5-4a5a-aeab-06f026418bfd)

1. To start editing the table, when it appears on the panel, you need to click ALT+ENTER.
1. Then the first item in the list becomes focus
1. User can navigate up and down with keyboard arrows
1. To select one of the parameters for editing, we can click on the ENTER key
1. If by chance we don't want to edit any of the parameters we can click on the ESC key to exit the editing mode
1. If you want to edit a parameter and to see the options related to it, click on the ENTER key, to open the dropdown with the options
1. If you don't want to replace a parameter, I click on the ESC key to exit the edit mode.
1. If by chance you select an option, the dropdown disappears and the system automatically saves the data, triggering a successful change message

**Details info:**

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/57179e45bf93871ccd99c501/d5b2cbe5-7d4e-4da7-b107-c5a75481d8ff)

* A subtitled representation will be required.

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/57179e45bf93871ccd99c501/22166905-3c34-4ae0-98df-15c8ded3170c)

* The parameters that we can edit while we have the bot turned on are identified with a different color.

title: New formatting of static tables

title: Implement Hummingbot specific exceptions for better error handling and unit testing
body:
I think this has been brought up earlier this year and I'd like to continue that discussion mainly because I feel that we are enforcing better unit tests practices at the moment.

**Issue**
I am noticing that in the some of the unit tests, we are waiting for certain actions to be performed and the way we are ensuring that the actions are executed is simply by using `asyncio.sleep()`. I figured this is not ideal since this could affect the CI runtime.

**Proposal**
My proposal is to leverage on the event-driven architecture that we already have with `EventLogger` and a set of Hummingbot-defined ErrorEvents(i.e. MarketOrderFailureEvent). Currently, I would say the errors raised are still pretty generic but with the inclusion of these events, it will not only help QA/Support better identify an issue, but also improve the debugging process.

Additionally, unit tests can be configured to wait on such events to be raised and perform the necessary assertions based on the data captured by the event. Also, it might be useful for strategies to be able to capture and handle errors like `ExceedingRateLimitEvent`.

body:
**Feature Suggestion**

I'm sorry if this is the wrong place to post this

I'm looking to hire a developer to customize the Spot Perpetual Arbitrage strategy , so the strategy can open multiple trades of the same pair ,  because the current strategy allow only one open position at one time
I  want to start multiple bots and each bot can open separate trade

for example i want to open a first  btc-usdt trade with
min_divergence = 2
min_convergence 1

and second  btc-usdt trade with 
min_divergence = 1.5
min_convergence=0.5

and third  btc-usdt trade

min_divergence = 2.5
min_convergence=1.5

this is the code that allow only one open trade(position)  so  you have to tweak this code

```
        if len(self.deriv_position) > 0:
            execute_arb = self.ready_for_execution(self.current_proposal, False)
        else:
            execute_arb = self.ready_for_execution(self.current_proposal, True)
```

```
    if execute_arb:
        self.logger().info(self.spread_msg())
        self.apply_slippage_buffers(self.current_proposal)
        self.apply_budget_constraint(self.current_proposal)
        await self.execute_arb_proposals(self.current_proposal, funding_msg)
```

```
        def ready_for_execution(self, proposal: ArbProposal, first: bool):
                """
                Check if the spread meets the required spread requirement for the right arbitrage.
                :param proposal: current proposal object
                :param first: True, if scanning for opportunity for first arbitrage, else, False
                :return: True if ready, else, False
                """
                spread = self.current_proposal.spread()
                if first and spread >= self.min_divergence and self._next_arbitrage_cycle_time < time.time(): 
                    return True
                elif not first and spread <= self.min_convergence and self._next_arbitrage_cycle_time < time.time():  
                    return True
                return False
```

title: Extend `AsyncThrottler` to handle decay-based rate limits

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

body:
As a developer, I want to be able to model decay-based rate limits when implementing connectors.

## Details
There exists a [library](https://github.com/dominiktraxl/pykrakenapi) that models this rate-limiting behaviour. The issue is that the library is not asynchronous. However, the rate-limiting portion of the code is short.

The proposition is to integrate that functionality into our existing throttler. 

## Implementation Suggestions
This can be performed by adding an internal counter for the rate limits, adding a new optional argument per `RateLimit` object to accept the decay rate, and making the time interval optional as well. The user can then supply either the decay rate or the time window and that rate limit will be evaluated accordingly.

## Definition of Done
* [ ] The `AsyncThrottler` is extended to support decay-based rate limits.

title: Set up unit tests framework and CI / CD systems

labels.name: epic
labels.description: Collection of stories that runs through different sprints

labels.name: gateway
labels.description: Related to Gateway module

body:
## Why
See the "Balance SOR Test Architecture" section from https://www.notion.so/hummingbot/Robustness-and-Reliability-0d3ba2870231494a9f45d00cf732a092

The intent here is to set up a smoothly running test pipeline to make writing and automatically running unit tests easy for the team.

## What
* Start with the same framework combination as Balance SOR unit tests (Mocha, Chai, Instanbul), for constructing our own unit tests.
* Make sure the configuration files used in unit testing is separated from the Git repository itself, and any potential Docker image builds (e.g. add it to `.gitignore`, and `.dockerignore`).
* Document the configurations needed for performing unit tests.
* Investigate into how to protect private configurations from being exposed with CI / CD and third-party pull requests. e.g. is a CI / CD system outside of Github required?
* Document a plan for a CI / CD setup that's secure against leaking private configurations.
* Set up and deploy the CI / CD system as documented.

* Auto-order size adjustment. If there isn't enough QUOTE balance to purchase more BASE assets, reduce the order size and adjust the order size based on the inventory tolerance like that in PureMM. 
* Implement price_band for this strategy and enhance the price brand so that it can be set as not a fixed number but a % from mid. This is to handle short term volatility. So instead of having the bot submitting orders normal way, if the market price BEFORE submitting the orders is outside of the price band, say in a case I recently encountered - CLOUT/USDT was at $100 (say price floor if it was set was at $95), it dropped lower than price_floor of $95 minutes to $81 within 10 minutes, the bot should only submit buy orders and not sell any given the sudden price drop. Need to think through the sequencing as that’s very important, because the detection of these abrupt moves would require the bot to compare current market price vs market price at last refresh OR compare current market price vs the average of the market price the last few refreshes (ie, the last few minutes) to be able to truly detect "abrupt" moves.

title: Pure MM - Non-existing hanging order never cancelled
body:
**Describe the bug**
This happens while running PMM on NDAX (not tested with other exchanges). On `stop` command, the bot successfully cancels all orders, but it sometimes stops monitoring server events before the confirmation for the cancellation of some of the orders comes in. On subsequent start, cancelling the previously "non-cancelled" order results in an error as the order no longer exists. In addition, in `c_start`, the previously "non-cancelled" order, which is now considered as "restored", is appended to `self._hanging_order_ids`. 

Originally identified [here](https://github.com/CoinAlpha/hummingbot/pull/3946#issuecomment-900230673).

**Steps To Reproduce**
Create a simple PMM on NDAX (one level suffices), and start/stop until the bug is reproduced (often a single stop is sufficient).

**Screenshots**
![Screen Shot 2021-08-18 at 2.25.57 PM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/60b2470e7aa82c4d096f7e09/9c46e278-864c-4098-baf8-3430844c3d67)

title: Always use exact order_amount value when placing orders

labels.name: enhancement

body:
**Feature Suggestion**

When using the hanging orders feature, an order placed below the order_amount value will not hang.

By introducing a "strict_order_amount" variable (Yes/No), it would be possible to tell HB to only place orders at the exact order_amount and not below.

**Impact**

This feature would prevent lower value hanging orders from being placed, which often results in a loss being made when the order is cancelled and a new order placed after a downward trend in mid price.

title: XEMM - Retry & Rollback Logic

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Upgrade or improvement to an existing hummingbot feature

labels.name: strategy
labels.description: Strategies ideas

body:
currently the cross exchange Market Making Strategy has a huge problem, at times of market turbulence, the taker order sometimes doesnt get processed, probably due to unavailable Exchange API.
This leads to strategy getting derailed and cause potentially huge losses as only one leg of the trade is executed.
its losing market neutrality and increases risk of carrying one coin over the other.
therefore currently the strategy is nice to test and while the market is stable it can be used as proof of concept, but for continous profitable trading its impossible, you end up always with distorted portfolio funds.

whats really important to fix this is trade completion check and a retry and rollback logic.
if not the entire trade gets executed properly, the strategy should initiate some retries and if unsuccessful, a rollback for the part of the trade that was executed.
after a rollback ideally the strategy should pause for a configurable time (5min i.e.) and then continue until it happens again.
if x rollbacks happen directly after each other, the strategy should pause and alert for manual review.
